loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business renting a house and rooms in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Nelita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance for her rental house and rooms.

Nelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her housing rental business

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 26 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal  in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Denise has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Denise aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the renovation of her fishing boat.

Gemma has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the renovation of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jididia

texts.en:
Jididia is 54 years old and married. Jididia has four children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business as a fish pond opeator in the Philippines. Jididia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and fish.

Jididia has been fish pond operator for 26 years, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Jididia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and fish food.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking mother of four and a very supportive partner to her husband Elmer. She is from Carmona, Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Amalia works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Amalia is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Amalia is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for the educational expense of her two children who are in college.

Amalia dreams for her children to be able to complete their studies and then find work that is suited to them. She wants them to have a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, steel, gravel, and sand to build a kitchen and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock her genge (small grocery store) with fast-moving items.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a hardworking mother of four. She is from Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Rizalina works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Rizalina is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Rizalina is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will add this loan to her beginning capital for a variety store business.

Rizalina wants her children to have good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To add to her capital to start her variety store business.

loans.name: Adioleta

texts.en:
Adioleta works hard to support her family. Adioleta is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Adioleta has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Adioleta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Annabelle has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy fabric, thread, zippers, garters for her tailoring business.

Cecilia has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, garters for her tailoring business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Editha has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, una comerciante que fue beneficiada por un anterior crédito kiva el cual invirtió en la compra de sabanas, manteles, cortinas y otra serie de productos encargados por sus clientes, obtuvo beneficios con la generación de utilidades, las cuales ayudaron a cubrir gastos de la familia y realizó mejoramientos en su vivienda.  Desde que recibió su crédito ha logrado tener más clientes y mayores ventas, a nivel personal mejoro su calidad de vida mediante arreglos a su vivienda y un nieto recibió grado de bachiller e inició estudios universitarios. La señora Margarita envió este mensaje para sus fondeadores  “Gracias por la ayuda a los empresarios”. La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le otorgo un nuevo crédito, que ella solicitó el cual  invirtirá en la compra de artículos de plata, sabanas y cubrelechos, y otros productos que corresponden a encargos de clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita is a saleswoman who benefited from a previous Kiva loan which she invested in the purchase of sheets, blankets, curtains and various other products requested by her clients. She benefited from the generation of profits from this loan which helped her to cover family expenses and make improvements to her house. 

Since she received her loan she has managed to gain more customers and greater sales. On a personal level she improved her quality of life by repairing her house, and a grandson received his high school diploma and began university.

Margarita sent this message to her lenders “Thank you for helping businesspeople”. The Fundación Mario Santa Domingo has granted her a new loan, which she will invest in the purchase of silver goods, sheets and bedspreads, and other products which her customers request.

loans.use: to buy silver goods, sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joann is 37 years old, and three of her children are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joann has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil.

In the future, Joann would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like peanuts, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is running a viable poultry project of two batches with 50 birds every six weeks. Before the receipt of the first loan, she was doing a piggery business and unfortunately all the pigs died after a disease outbreak. The loan helped her to start another business, which is profitable. She helped her husband take a driver’s license test, bought clothes for herself and her family, and is sustaining the betterment of her family. She has gained recognition and respect in the family and community at large. Caroline would like to expand her business through increasing the number of birds in each batch. As soon as the veterinarian clears the outbreak of the piggery disease in her area, she would like to do both pigs and chickens, as they are both profitable businesses to invest in. If she gets a bigger loan, she wants to increase her production.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery drinks and resell them at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, una apasionada por las artesanías decidió incorporarse en la comercialización de bolsos, carteras y sombreros artesanales elaborados por indigenas, desde el año 2010, cuando una amiga le sugirió este negoció;  a partir de ese momento esta actividad  la ha ejercido la señora Julia con toda la dedicación  y empeño,  trabajando 10 horas diarias.  Esta emprendedora mujer tiene 61 años y dos hijos, sueña con remodelar su vivienda, que esta ubicada en un barrio al sur occidente de Barranquilla,  ella considera que puede hacer su sueño realidad trabando con mucho esfuerzo como lo ha estado haciendo.  Sus proveedores son artesanos y  están fuera de la ciudad donde ella reside, ella compra estos productos de contado y brinda facilidad de pago a sus clientes.  Ofrece productos de calidad a muy buen precio y un servicio inigualable, por eso anhela abrir un local comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo Nel cual utilizará en la compra de los productos que vende y serán ofrecidos  a su clientela, como bolsos, carteras y sombreros, a. Se puede considerar que la recuperación de la inversión es altamente efectiva gracias a la experiencia y conocimiento de mercado que esta microempresaria posee.
texts.en:
Julia, an admirer of artisan crafts, decided to start a business selling artisan bags, wallets and hats made by the indigenous population in 2010, when a friend suggested this business to her. Since then, she has put all of her dedication and effort into this business, working 10 hours a day. 

This enterprising woman is 61 years old and has two children. She dreams of remodeling her house, which is located in a southwestern neighborhood of Barranquilla. She believes that she can make her dream come true by working with plenty of effort, as she has been doing. Her suppliers are artisans and live outside the city where she lives. She buys these products in cash and offers payment facilities to her clients. She offers quality products at a very good price with an incomparable service, which is why she wishes to open a commercial property.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy the products she will then sell to her clients, such as bags, wallets, and hats. Due to the experience and market knowledge this small business owner possesses, it can be considered that the payback on this loan will be highly effective.

loans.use: to buy products to sell to her clients, such as bags, wallets, and hats.

loans.name: Marchia

texts.en:
Marchia is a hardworking mother of two and a very supportive partner to her husband Renato. She is from Laguna, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Marchia works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Marchia is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Marchia is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for the tuition fees of her children, one who is in elementary and the other is in secondary.

Marchia hopes that she will be financially stable and free from any debt. She wants to have a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde works hard to support her family. Melinde is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish, plastic bags, etc for her business.

Melinde has been in this business for 4 years now..

In the future, Melinde would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish, plastic bags, etc for her business.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is 45 years old and married with three children who are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Simplicia has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Romer

texts.es:
Romer es un hombre de 25 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos de cinco, cuatro y dos años de edad y su negocio es la venta de derivados lácteos.
Él es emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Huayrocondo’ una zona cercana al lago Titicaca, de clima frío y seco y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Romer es de tez morena, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura, y sus tres niños que se encuentran a su cuidado, viven en una casa propia hecha de adobe y tienen electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la elaboración de derivados de la leche, como; queso, yogurt, nata y también vende leche pura. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en seis años que lleva con esta actividad. Su segunda actividad es de transportista, en su auto propio se encarga de trabajar como taxi. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio lechero. Él desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ganado lechero para producir mayor cantidad de leche y abastecer a sus clientes. 
Es por esos motivos que Romer solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Romer is 25 years old, married, and has three children who are 5, 4, and 2 years old.  He is entrepreneurial, responsible and hard working; he sells dairy products for a living in the community of Huayrocondo which is near Lake Titicaca. The climate is cold and dry and it is 3800 meters above sea level (approx 12,500 '). 

Romer has a dark complexion, is of medium height, and his mother tongue is Aymara, but he speaks Spanish too. He lives with his wife, who works in agriculture, and their three children who are dependent upon him. They live in their own house which is made of adobe, and they have electricity and well water. His occupation is making dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, and cream, and he also sells milk. This is his second loan cycle with the institution in the six years he has been doing this work. His other occupation is a taxi service for which he uses his own car.

Romer's dream is to improve his dairy business. He would like to invest in his business by buying dairy cattle so he can produce more milk for his customers. This is why Romer is applying for a loan - so he can buy dairy cattle to increase his production and his sales.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Mary Marvy

texts.en:
A married parent of four children, Mary Marvy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Mary Marvy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell through her "buy and sell" business.

Mary Marvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue improving the conditions in her dwelling so that she and her family can live in a better environment.

loans.name: Niena

texts.en:
Niena is 25 years old. She is single and works hard to support her parents. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming rice.

Niena is borrowing PHP 4,500 through NWTF to buy additional linen, threads, etc for her tailoring business.

Niena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional linen, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to weed, and cut and collect the fruits, and pay labour costs, for the coffee plantation of her father.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Las Lucianitas Group

texts.es:
De 41 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, es casada y cuenta con 4 hijos los primeros 2 hijos ya tienen vida independiente y los 2 últimos son estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad, con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida. (Carina es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de frutas negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de 9 años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Carina para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de corte y blusa típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad para poder realizar ventas mayores.
texts.en:
At 41 years of age, the borrower has great aspirations to teach her community and everyone who visits about the activity that she pursues with so much passion and dedication. She is married and has four children, two of whom have their own independent lives; the other two are students at the school close by in her community. The borrower has a desire to improve her life, and to achieve her biggest dreams. (Carina can be found on the right in the photograph).

The work that she does, very carefully, is purchasing and selling typical clothing. She does this activity both in her home, and in central locations throughout the community where she lives. The other activity she partakes in is fruit sales; she began doing this business with her sister, and has for more than nine years. It helps to generate money which contributes to the well being of her family, and improves her economic conditions (for her family and community) as well.

The borrower has served as a good example in her community, which is why this group of women have united with Carina in order to undertake their own business ventures. Each one of the women wants the chance to be able to get ahead, and to garner important income.

Carina is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise, such as typical blouses, which she will sell in the surrounding areas. One of her greatest aspirations is to have a booth in her community's market so that she can generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as traditional blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, clothing, make up and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Remsel

texts.en:
Remsel works hard to support her family. Remsel is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy wood, nails, wood glue, paints, etc.

Remsel has been in this business for seven years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Remsel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, wood glue, paints, etc. to make furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, body cream, cologne, perfume, and stationery.

loans.name: Akua Amessiwoalo Segbedzi

texts.fr:
Akua est célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Elle vit à Soviépé et commercialise depuis 5 ans la vente des ignames. Par manque de fonds de roulement conséquent, elle s’approvisionne au marché 4 fois par mois. Sa clientèle ne cesse de s’agrandir grâce à son accueil et aux petites remise qu’elle fait pour attirer ses clients.
Afin d’éviter les ruptures de stock, elle souhaite augmenter son stock par l’achat d’une calebasse d’ignames.
texts.en: Akua is single and the mother of one child. She lives in Soviépé, and for five years she has been selling coco yams. Since she lacks sufficient working capital, she buys her goods at the market four times per month. Her clientele is always growing thanks to her hearty welcome and the small reduction in price she gives to attract customers. In order to avoid running short of goods, she wants to add to her stock by buying a calabash of coco yams.

loans.use: to buy a calabash of coco yams for resale

loans.name: Alcides,

texts.es: Alcides, inició su negocio en el año 1974, cuando identificó una oportunidad de vender frente a un colegio jugos naturales, empanadas, arepas, bolis, confites y golosinas para los estudiantes y transeúntes del sector, desde entonces ha sido su fuente principal ingresos. Este emprendedor hombre tiene 63 años y tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 22 y 14 años de edad  y una hija de 27 años de edad. Hace 40 años ejercer esta actividad y tiene 23 años viviendo en el barrio donde tiene su negocio que esta ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado en el horario de 6 a.m. a  6 p.m.,  y sus ventas se realizan de contado.  El compra sus insumos para el negocio a los proveedores del centro de Barranquilla, pero su capital le es insuficiente para la demanda que actualmente tiene en el negocio. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva, a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar dulces y frutas tropicales, necesarias para su funcionamiento y para que su negocio maneje un mejor stock de producto y genera una recuperación de la inversión fluida.
texts.en:
Alcides began his business in the year 1974, when he identified an opportunity to sell things like natural juices, empanadas, arepas, pens, sweets, and goodies in front of a school for the students and passerby's in the area. Since then, this has been his main source of income.

This entrepreneurial man is 63 years old; he has four sons, aged 32, 30, 22, and 14, as well as one daughter, who is 27. For 40 years, he has pursued this activity, and he has spent the past 23 years living in the neighborhood where his business is located (the southwestern part of Barranquilla).

He works Monday through Saturday from 6 in the morning to 6 at night, and his sales are done mostly in cash. He buys his supplies for his business from suppliers in the central part of Barranquilla, however, his current capital is insufficient for his business' demand.

Because of this, he is asking for a loan from Kiva through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy sweets and tropical fruits, which are necessary for the functioning of his business. It will help him to manage his business with a better variety of products, and therefore provide a smooth recovery for his investment.

loans.use: to buy candy and tropical fruit

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 49 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
Roslyn is a 27-year-old married woman with three children; one child is in school.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Roslyn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Roslyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Roslyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Weyma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Weyma works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Weyma is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of linens, etc for her tailoring business.

Weyma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of linens for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sofanor

texts.es: Sofanor,  tiene un negocio donde presta los servicios de reparación  y venta de llantas, adquirió la experiencia trabajando con un hermano en una llantería, destreza que le sirvió para iniciar este negocio.  El local está ubicado en un sector muy concurrido por vehículos  al sur occidente de Barranquilla, sus clientes realizan los pagos en efectivo y  el negocio abre a partir de las 6:30 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. de lunes a sábado, sus compras las realiza de contado a proveedores de llantas y neumáticos. Sofanor está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de llantas, parches y neumáticos. El aspira que con esta inversión se potencialice su negocio y haya mas variedad de productos. Él tiene 47 años y tiene un hijo de 24 años y 2 hijas de 22 y 21 años, su cónyuge también tiene su negocio propio un almacén misceláneo. Su meta familiar es brindarles estudios a sus hijos y espera a futuro ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofanor has a repair business and sells tyres. He gained experience working with a brother in a tyre shop, a skill that helped him to start this business. His shop is situated in an busy traffic area in the south west of Barranquilla.

His customers pay in cash and the business opens from 6.30 am until 6pm from Monday to Saturday. He makes purchases in cash from providers of wheel rims and tyres.

Sofanor is asking for a Kiva loan, the first loan he has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy wheel rims, patches and tyres. He hopes that with this investment he will maximise the potential of his business and have a greater variety of products.

He is 47 years old and has one son of 24 and two daughters who are 22 and 21 years old. His partner also has her own business, a general store. His aim for his family is to provide for his children to study and he hopes in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wheel rims, patches and tyres.

loans.name: Nenian

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenian works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and fishing. Nenian is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Nenian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 54 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

Marjorie has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Marjorie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years.

Rosemarie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods for sale, including canned goods, eggs, chips, and sugar. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like spices, canned goods, meat, fish, etc. for her restaurant business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 15 years. Marilyn earns more income from peanut vending.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like spices, canned goods, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Genalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paints, nails, etc for her furniture making business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paints, and nails for her business

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 35 years old and married with nine children, seven of whom are in school. Ma. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks and groceries.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for one year.

In the future Ma. Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. Ma. Luz is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sheene

texts.en:
Sheene is 20 years old and married with one child; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, eggs, and noodles.

Sheene has been in this business for one year.

In the future Sheene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Ian Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ian Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Ian Mae is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ian Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Keeshia Vence

texts.en:
Keeshia Vence works hard to support her family. Keeshia Vence is 21 years old, has one child and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Keeshia Vence has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Keeshia Vence would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. Liza is married and has a dried fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Liza has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more general store stock to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Amalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more general store stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like spices, canned goods, and chips.

Inocencia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming corn and rice and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like spices, canned goods, and chips

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 29 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jerose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jerose works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Jerose is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Jerose has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Femme célibataire âgée de 37 ans, Adjovi réside à Baguida non loin du Bar KOBOKOBO et achète du pain et des sachets plastiques qu’elle revend avec du beurre et de l’avocat depuis 2003 ; pour cela elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois et vend de manière ambulante au grand marché de Lomé. Adjovi désire obtenir un soutien financier pour plus s’approvisionner et satisfaire sa clientèle, et aussi subvenir à ses propres besoins et se prendre totalement en charge.
texts.en:
Adjovi is a single woman who is 37 years old. She lives in Baguida not far from the Kobokobo Bar. Since 2003, she has been buying bread and plastic bags that she sells along with butter and avocados. She buys her supplies three times a month and sells on foot at the Grand Market of Lomé.


Adjovi would like to receive financial support to buy more products, satisfy her clientele, meet her needs, and take total care of herself.

loans.use: to buy four dozen plastic bags.

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is 52 years old and unmarried with five children. She has a small farm where she raises cows that she can sell in her community or to the public. She has been doing this for six years. Vine needs a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle food and a new wooden tub for water. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Vine will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, nails, iron poles, cattle food and a new wooden tub for water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food and drinks for his restaurant.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 39 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Аиды среднее образование. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2001 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Аида в хозяйстве имеет: 10 коров, 5 лошадей, 20 овец и 30 коз. А также есть земельный надел мерою 0,5 ГА, на котором она выращивает кукурузу. Ее деятельность приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Аида является одним из трех участников группы "Береке". В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет построить большой сарай.
texts.en:
Aida is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  By nature, she is a quiet, well-balanced and hardworking.  She has been raising livestock for many years now, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this field in 2001.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns 10 cows, five horses, 20 sheep and 30 goats.  She also uses 0.5 hectare of allotted land on which she grows corn.  She makes about 9,000 som (KGS) per month from her activity.

Aida is a member of the "Bereke" group which consists of three members.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS).  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business.  In the future, she would also like to build a big barn.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est mariée et mère de deux enfantes. Elle est née à Vogan,  âgée de 27 elle vit dans le quartier de Dabada Kondji. Elle fait le commerce des habits de liquidation depuis sept ans et est ambulante, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par semaine et va de maison en maison pour chercher de la clientèle.
Les revenus lui permettront d’aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales et à l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Afiwa is a married mother to two children who was born in Vogan. She is 27 years old and lives in Dabada Kondji district. She has been selling clearance sale clothing for seven years. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé twice per week and goes from house to house to look for customers. The profits will allow her to assist her husband with their household expenses and their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sets of clothes

loans.name: Joséphine Povi

texts.fr: Joséphine est  veuve et mère de cinq enfants. Elle est âgée de 64 ans et vend  des bijoux il y a 15 ans ; elle achète les bijoux au grand marché de Lomé qu’elle revend dans le marché d’Akodésséwa un quartier du canton de Bè. Elle sollicite un crédit   pour l’achat 6 colliers et 15 paires de boucles d’oreilles. Avec les revenus elle pourra  faire face aux charges scolaires et quotidiennes  de ses cinq enfants.
texts.en:
Joséphine is a widow and a mother of five children. She is 64 years old and has been selling jewelry for 15 years. She buys the jewelry from the Lomé Grand Market and resells them in the Akodésséwa market, in a neighborhood around Bè. 

She is seeking a loan to buy six necklaces and 15 pairs of earrings.

With her profits, she will be able to cover school fees and the everyday [needs] of her five children.

loans.use: to buy six necklaces and 15 pairs of earrings

loans.name: Rethy

texts.en:
Rethy is a 19-year-old freshman at university in a city. He is from the Takeo province of Cambodia. His major is banking and finance. To cover his study expenses, he has also worked as a waiter in a restaurant earning approximately $5 per day. 

Due to the fact that he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees, Rethy would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to finish the foundation year at university successfully. 

For his dream, he wants to work in a bank.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Amanecer está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que deben esforzarse un poco más para mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir que esta en un nivel medio. Ella realiza productos de limpieza para la venta, y con esto ayuda a su familia para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus seres queridos.
Gloria pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de limpieza para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amanecer (Sunrise) is in its fourth cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other succeed and get ahead. During their poverty stoplight survey they found 10 of the members to be below the poverty line which means they all need to exert themselves a little more in order to improve. 
One of the members, Mrs. Gloria, was in a poverty level of two during the last survey, which is to say a medium level. She sells cleaning products and through this is able to help her family and cover the necessities of her loved ones. 
Gloria requests this loan to be able to purchase cleaning products, in order to continue her business and improve her and her families' economic situation.

loans.use: purchase cleaning products for sale.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est âgée de 33ans à Bè, elle est marie et mère de 03 enfants.  Elle fait le commerce de draps et serviettes il y a 13 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Hédzranawé et revend au marché d’Akodesséwa. Elle veut avec ce crédit acheter  un tas de serviette et un tas de draps. Les revenus lui  permettront de contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Dédé is a 33 year old from Bé. She is married and the mother of three children. She has bought and sold sheets and towels for thirteen years. She buys her supplies in the market in Hédzranawé and sells them at the market in Akodesséwa.
With this loan, she wants to buy a bundle of towels and a bundle of sheets. The income from this will allow her to help with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of sheets and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw to transport goods from suppliers to his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete a necessary extention to his house.

loans.name: Al- Karama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Karama. It consists of three women and two men who are all hardworking. They live in Taiz city, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 225,000 YER from AMB. 

Ne'ema is 39 years old, and a married woman with five children. She is an uneducated woman, but works hard to improve the living conditions of her family. She has a strong determination to go ahead. In the beginning, Ne'ema started her own business with a small amount of money, which she saved up selling makeup, accessories, and perfumes door to door in order to help her husband cover the necessary expenses of the family. 

She thinks this business will be profitable for her, if she increased her sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, perfumes, cosmetics and other items to be able to meet all the demands of her customers.

Ne'ema expects a boost in her income. She hopes to open a shop to sell all the women's accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, perfumes, cosmetics and other items to be able to meet all the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building wood to make a roof for the rest of the rooms of his house

loans.name: Siala

texts.en:
Siala is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Siala needs a loan to buy fertilizer, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete and new overalls. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Siala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crops, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete and new overalls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and paint to renovate his house on the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise, and to sell some of them

loans.name: Rica Jane

texts.en:
Rica Jane is 43 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Rica Jane is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rica Jane has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rica Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine, have medical exams done on his children and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Marlis

texts.es: Marlis, tiene 40 años de edad y cuenta que desde muy joven le apasionó la confección de ropa y por eso se dedicó a aprender este oficio. En el año 2011, abrió su taller de confecciones y desde entonces ha estado trabajando en el horario de 10:00 a.m. a 8:00p.m. de lunes a domingo.  Sus principales clientes están ubicados en el barrio donde ella reside en el municipio de Soledad, quienes están fidelizados por la buena confección y el excelente servicio.  Ella compra a sus proveedores de contado y sus pedidos se generan por encargos de sus clientes quienes cancelan a crédito.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de una mesa de corte, una vitrina e insumos como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, entre otros.  Marlis considera que esta inversión va a mejora sus condiciones laborales, puesto que estas herramientas de trabajo optimizan la productividad de su negocio y sus tiempos de entrega.
texts.en:
Marlis is 40 years old. She says that since she was young, she has been passionate about making clothing, which is why she decided to learn this trade.

In 2011 she opened her clothing workshop, and since then she has been working from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm from Monday to Sunday. Her main clients are located in the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Soledad. They are loyal to her because she does good work and provides excellent service. She purchases from her suppliers in cash, and her orders are from clients pay with credit.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has done. She wants to purchase a cutting table, a display case, and products such as fabric, thread, needles and buttons.

Marlis thinks that this investment will improve her work conditions, because these work tools optimize her business's productivity and her delivery times.

loans.use: to purchase a cutting table, a display cabinet, and products such as fabric, thread, needles an dbuttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many of goats, in order to raising them for selling.

loans.name: Adrian Israel

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre de 29 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijas de cuatro y otra de un año, y su negocio es la venta de artículos plásticos transparentes.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Ferropetrol’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio mayorista, a una altitud de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frio y seco.
Adrian es de tez morena, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su esposa que trabaja vendiendo dulces en una cancha de futbol que queda cerca a su casa, y viven con sus dos hijas en la casa de su padre, que cuenta con agua potable, luz eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de envases plásticos para diferentes usos como; envases, platos descartables, recipientes para comida, etc. esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en siete años que viene realizando esta labor. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina freidora para abrir un restaurante de comida rápida para llevar.
Es por esos motivos que Adrian solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina freidora para abrir un restaurante de comida rápida para llevar.
texts.en:
Adrian is a 29 year old man. He is married and has two children one is 4 and the other is 1 year old. His business is selling transparent plastic objects. He is enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in the ‘Ferropetrol’ district a place known for it's wholesale commerce at an altitude of 3800 meters above sea level, It has a cold and dry climate.

Adrian is dark-skinned and of medium stature. His native language is Aymara and he uses Spanish in business. He lives with his wife who sells sweets at a football stadium close to their house and his two children in his father's house. The house has water and electricity but is not connected to the sewer.

His business is selling plastic containers for different uses such as containers, disposable plates, food trays, etc. This is his second loan with the institution in the 7 years he has had this business. His dream is to expand his business by buying a refrigerator to open a take-out fast food restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to open a take-out fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her family

loans.name: Maura Antonia

texts.es:
Maura de 56 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y luchadora. No estudio porque vivía en una pobreza en donde solo alcanzaban para comprar la comidita diaria, entonces mejor decidió aprender a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos de la casa, luego decidió casarse y junto con su esposo tuvieron 7 hijos de 40, 38, 26, 24, 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, de los cuales 4 de ellos ya se casaron.

Maura se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de tomate, cebolla, rábano, pepino, chile, pipianes etc., desde hace 35 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por ver la necesidad económica que tenían. Para llegar a su trabajo Maura camina 3 kilómetros, su horario es de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm, ahora en día esta empezando con el negocio de la crianza de especies menores como cerdos, con esto ella espera poder obtener un poco mas de ingresos donde podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprarconcentrado para sus cerdos de engorde, donde espera venderlos en un periodo de 60 días.

 El sueño de Maura es ampliar mas su negocio de crianza de cerdos, darle estudio a su hijo y aumentar la siembra de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Maura, 56, is a hard-working and feisty woman.  She didn't study because she lived in such poverty that they only had enough to buy the daily food.  So she decided to learn to work in order to help her parents with the household expenses.  Then she decided to get married and together with her husband they had seven children, 40, 38, 26, 24, 22, 20 and 18, of whom four are already married.
Maura has been making a living from agriculture and the cultivation of tomato, onion, radish, cucumber, chili, squash, etc. for 35 years, work that she learned from her parents, seeing the economic necessity they had.  In order to get to her work, Maura walks three kilometers.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m..  Nowadays she is starting a business raising small animals such as pigs.  With this, she hopes to be able to obtain a little more income as she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.
The loan she is requesting is to buy concentrated feed for her fattening pigs as she hopes to sell them in a period of 60 days.
Maura's dreams are to increase her business of raising pigs, give schooling to her son, and increase the cultivation of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her fattening pigs as she hopes to sell them in a period of 60 days.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kids of goats, to raise and sell them.

loans.name: Taufono

texts.en:
Taufono is a 64-year-old widow with 5 children. 

She owns and operates a small general store; selling a variety of items, and has been doing this for 5 years. Taufono needs a loan to buy a display fridge, a mini freezer, and a large chest freezer. 

Taufono hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to the capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a display fridge, a mini freezer, and a large chest freezer

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de panadería. Ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados locales. la socia ya lleva 5 años en su venta de pan y le va muy bien. la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, Monica, por medio de este negocio, quiere salir adelante y su sueño es crecer el negocio de panaderia. La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos típicos para hacer pan como huevos, mantequilla y harina.

Monica esta muy agradecido por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de una manera responsable.
texts.en:
Monica continues with her bakery business.  She prepares different kinds of bread and then sells them at various local markets. She has been selling bread for five years and it is going very well. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.  

Monica, through this business, wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her bakery business. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to make bread, such as eggs, butter and flour.

Monica is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more perfumes and incense to resell to the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement, in order to renovate her family's house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate his old house and to build new rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ready-made women's clothes, accessories, perfumes, and other items, for his wife to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Las Fortaleza De 5 De Junio Group

texts.es:
a 4 horas de San Lorenzo vive MIRALDINA en una comunidad muy vulnerable debido a su lejanía con pueblos que cuentan con servicios básicos.
MIRALDINA tiene 3 hijos y por varios años se ha dedicado a la extracción de pequeñas partículas de oro en el Rio que atraviesa su pueblo. 
ella tiene la idea de ponerse una tienda de alimentos. donde sus vecinos puedan encontrar todos los productos necesarios para los alimentos de sus familias. 
normalmente la gente de esta comunidad - debe trasladarse hasta San Lorenzo. a una distancia de 4 horas aprovechando el único turno que viaja a este sector diariamente cuando no existen inconvenientes de derrumbo en la vía.

sus hijos estudian y gozan de buena salud. ella desea servir a sus comunidad y brindar la facilidad de conseguir sus productos en el mismo pueblo.
fruto de sus trabajo. ha logrado construir su propia casa. en su comunidad no cuentan con servicios de agua potable y consumen agua del río. no cuentan con señal telefónica ni medios de comunicación televisiva ni radio. pero es una comunidad considerada una de las mas limpias de la provincia de Esmeraldas.

agradece la oportunidad de poder tener su propio negocio y a través de este servir a sus vecinos en la comunidad.

nota:

en la imagen aparecen 8 personas pero una de ellas no realizó el tramite de préstamo.
texts.en:
Miraldina lives four hours from San Lorenzo in a community that is very vulnerable due to its distance from towns that have basic services. Miraldina has three children, and for a number of years she has worked extracting little particles of gold from the river that goes through her town. She has the idea of setting up a grocery store where her neighbors can find all the necessary products to feed their families.

Normally the people in this community need to go to San Lorenzo [to buy groceries], a distance of four hours, taking advantage of the only regularly scheduled transportation that travels to this sector daily, when there are no problems with landslides on the route.

Her children go to school and enjoy good health. She wants to serve her community and offer [her neighbors] the convenience of obtaining their products in the same town. From the fruit of her labor, she has managed to build her own house. In her community, they don't have potable water service and they consume water from the river. They don't have telephone signals or communication media such as television or radios, but it is a community that is considered one of the cleanest in the province of Esmeraldas.

She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to have her own business and through this to serve her neighbors in the community.

Note: eight people appear in the photograph, but one of them didn't complete the paperwork for the loan.

loans.use: to buy products of basic necessity to sell in her community, such as rice, sugar, beans, lentils, pasta, oats, oils, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, household articles, and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado.  Esta casada y madre de 6 hijos.  Su esposo trabaja en fincas, cultiva maíz y frijol y sus hijos cuando tienen tiempo libre apoyan también en los trabajos. 

Aquilina desde pequeña sea  dedicado a los quehaceres del hogar y  a trabajar en fincas, ella con mucho esfuerzo camina 1 hora para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo (fincas).

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para sacar las cosechas de maíz y frijol del lugar donde a cultivado que se encuentra a 3 kilómetros y medio de su lugar de habitación y tiene que pagar mosos para tapiscar el maíz y amarrar el frijol, más el transporte para trasladar las cosechas.

Ella anhela en un futuro seguir trabajando para mejorar la casa, y mejorar sus condiciones económicas y con dedicación  ver a sus hijos como profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Aquilina, who is 41 years old, went to school through third grade. She is married and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works on farms. He raises corn and beans, and their children also help them with the work when they have free time.

Aquilina has done housework and worked in the fields since she was a little girl. With great effort, she walks an hour to arrive at her workplace (the fields).

The loan that she is applying for from CrediCampo is to gather the harvests of corn and beans from the place where they are grown, which is three and a half kilometers from the place where she lives, and she has to pay farmhands to harvest the corn and gather the beans, in addition to the transportation to transport the harvests.

In the future, she wants to continue working in order to improve her house and improve their economic conditions and with dedication, see her children as successful professionals.

loans.use: to pay farmhands to harvest the corn and gather the beans, in addition to transportation to transport the harvests.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana de 53 años de edad, es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo y luchadora, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 6° grado, luego decidió acompañarse y junto con su compañero de vida procrearon 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, después de un tiempo su esposo falleció quedando Juana solo con sus 3 hijos, pues son los que viven con ella y le ayudan a trabajar para salir adelante.

 Juana se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura (siembra de maíz), desde hace mas de 20 años, oficio que lo aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a esto y por la necesidad económica en que vivían ya que cuando su compañero de vida falleció, quedo a cargo de todos los gastos de su familia, para llegar a su trabajo Juana camina 3 kilómetros todos los días trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 4 vacas de repasto, con las cuales dentro de un tiempo espera tener leche para poder venderla y así lograra tener un poco mas de ingresos y con eso podrá tener una mejor alimentación para ella y sus hijos.

El sueño de Juana es tener 10 vacas lecheras y darle estudio a uno de sus hijos hasta que sea profesional para que en un futuro tenga mejores oportunidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juana, 53 years old, is a committed, hard-working woman. She is a homemaker who attended school through the sixth grade. She then decided to enter into a relationship and together with her life partner she had three children who are now 23, 21, and 19 years old. After a while her husband died and Juana was left only with the three children, they live with her and help her work to get ahead. 

Juana has made a living for over twenty years raising cattle and farming (corn crops). She  learned from her parents, who had always done this work, and in order to meet the financial needs at home, since she was left in charge of the household when her life partner died. Juana walks three kilometers every day to reach her workplace and her workday is from 7 am to 4 pm.

She is requesting the loan from this institution to buy four grazing cows that will in time produce milk. She will sell the milk to get a little more income, and in this way she will be able to improve the diet for herself and her children.

Juana's dream is to have 10 dairy cows and to provide education up to professional level for one of her children so that he or she may have better work opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy four dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, bricks, iron, and steel, to build an independent room, which will enable him to read and study in his house.

loans.name: Ibeth

texts.es: Ibeth, reside en un barrio del municipio de barranquilla, donde tiene ubicado su negocio de café internet, repuestos para computadores y almacén misceláneo.  La idea del negocio surgió cuando su esposo que es técnico en mantenimiento de computadores le propuso este negocio y de inmediato buscaron los recursos para dar inicio.  Ibeth  abre su negocio todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a 7 p.m. y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes del lugar, las ventas se hacen de contado por ello su flujo de caja es muy dinámico. Ella realiza las compras de contado a distribuidores y  mayoristas.  Ibeth tiene 28 años y es una mujer muy comprometida, su desafío es fidelizar a sus clientes ofreciéndoles buenos precios y un excelente servicio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo lpara ser utilizado en la compra de repuestos para computadores. Con esta iversión mejora su negoc pues se incrmentas las ventas y las utilidades.
texts.en:
Ibeth lives in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where her business -- an internet cafe, spare parts for computers, and miscellaneous sales -- is located. The idea for the business arose when her husband, who is a maintenance technician for computers, suggested this business to her, and they immediately sought the resources to set it up. 

Ibeth opens her business every day on an 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. schedule, and her principal customers are her neighbors and people who pass by the place. Sales are made for cash. For that reason, her cash flow is very dynamic. She makes her purchases for cash from distributors and wholesalers. Ibeth is 28 years old, and she is a very committed woman. Her challenge is building loyalty among her customers by offering them good prices and excellent service.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which will be used for the purchase of spare parts for computers. With this investment, her business will improve, since the sales and the profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for computers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials like cement, wood, and bricks, with which to build a suitable house for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase windows, doors, and some construction materials with which to finish the house from the inside.

loans.name: Israel Mauricio

texts.es:
Israel es un joven estudiante de 19 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de La Paz y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hermano mayor. Su papá es taxista al igual que su hermano y su mamá trabaja como mensajera en una empresa de courrier.  

Israel nos comenta que se siente muy orgulloso de su familia pues a pesar de vivir con varias restricciones económicas y la delicada salud de su mamá, todos lo apoyan para que continúe sus estudios.

Israel desde muy pequeño tuvo la oportunidad de ayudar a su tía y a su abuela en la preparación de alimentos que ellas vendían en un puesto ambulante de comida, fue en ese momento donde encontró su vocación que es la gastronomía.
 
Actualmente Israel está cursando el cuarto semestre de la carrera de Gastronomía, su sueño es tener su propio restaurante para que con los conocimientos adquiridos ponga en alto las virtudes y cualidades de la comida boliviana; por tal motivo agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán seguir estudiando y cumplir sus sueños de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Israel is a young student 19 years old. He was born in the city of La Paz and lives at home with his parents and his oldest brother. His father is a taxi driver like his brother and his mother works as a messenger for a courier service. Israel tells us that he feels very proud of his family because despite  living with various financial restrictions and the delicate health of his mother, all of them support him so he can continue his studies.

Since he was very young Israel took the opportunity to help his aunt and his grandmother preparing food they sold from a traveling food cart and it was from this time that he found his vocation in gastronomy.

Israel is currently in his fourth semester of his Gastronomy degree study. His dream is to have his own restaurant so that with his acquired knowledge he can offer the virtues and qualities of Bolivian food; for that reason he is grateful to the people whose financial resources will permit him to continue studying and fulfilling his dreams of becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for his degree studies in Gastronomy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish clothes, to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, domiciliada en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, emprendió su negocio cuando quedo sin empleo en el año 2013 y una amiga le ayudó suministrándole unos productos que fueron su inventario inicial.  Al estar motivada por haber generado ventas ella decidió incorporarse con empresas especializadas en venta por catalogo y realizo sus primeros pedidos.  Esta mujer de 36 años ofrece a sus clientes productos cosméticos, de aseo personal y ropa, en el horario de 10 a.m. a 7 p.m. de lunes a domingo.  Su compromiso se ve reflejado en las utilidades que le genera su actividad con la que espera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.  Ella realiza sus compras de contado y vende sus productos a crédito a los vecinos y amigos del barrio.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para mejorar su stock  de productos, ella se esta aprovisionando para la temporada decembrina en la que se incrementas las venta, por eso comprará artículos de belleza y de aseo personal, accesorios navideños y decorativos, etc. Su meta a futuro es consolidar su negocio con mas capital de trabajo y  abrir un local comercial.
texts.en:
Maria, who lives in a neighborhood located southwest of Barranquilla, started her business when she became unemployed in 2013. A friend helped her, supplying her with some products that were her initial inventory. Motivated because she was able to make sales, she decided to affiliate herself with companies that specialize in catalog sales, and she made her first orders. 

This woman, who is 36 years old, offers her customers cosmetics, personal care products, and clothing from 10 a.m. until 7 p.m. Monday through Sunday. The profits that she makes through this job reflect her commitment, and she hopes to use her earnings to give her son a better quality of life. She makes cash purchases and sells her products on credit to neighbors and friends in the neighborhood. 

Currently, she is applying for a CrediKiva, which is the first loan request that she makes to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to improve her supply of products. She is preparing herself for the holiday season, during which sales increase. For this reason, she will buy beauty and personal care products as well as decorative and Christmas accessories, etc. Her goals for the future are to strengthen her business with more working capital and to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty and personal care products as well as decorative and Christmas accessories, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion Marina

texts.es:
Concepción de 34 años de edad, es una señora muy luchadora, es ama de casa, estudio hasta el 6° grado por recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios. Esta casada y es madre de 5 hijos de 15, 12, 10, 6 y 1 de edad los cuales todos se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja como maestro en un centro educativo y Concepción se dedica a la ganadería y también vende helados de diferentes sabores en su casa, el trabajo de la ganadería lo hace desde hace unos años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por la necesidad en que vivían.

Para llegar a su trabajo ella y sus dos hijos que le ayudan tienen que caminar 2 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 4 vacas lecheras, con ellas lograra tener mas ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia y de ella.

El sueño de Concepción es tener un negocio de lácteos venta de queso, quesillo, crema etc., aumentar el hato ganadero y ahorrar mucho para darle estudio a uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 34 years old. She is a fighting woman, a housewife, and she studied until the sixth grade but could not continue her studies because of financial reasons. She is married and is the mother of five children who are 15, 12, 10, 6, and a 1 year old, all of them studying. Her husband works as a teacher in an education center and Concepción works with cattle and also sells different flavored ice cream flavors in her home.
