She has been working with livestock for the last few years, work that she learned from her parents to meet life’s necessities. 

In order to get to work she and her two children that help her have to walk two kilometers, working from 6:00AM until 3:00PM.

She is asking for a loan from the institution in order to buy four dairy cows as with them she will have more income for the livelihood for her and her family.

Concepción’s dream is to have a dairy business selling cheese, cottage cheese, cream, etc., to increase her dairy herd, and save a lot in order to provide an education for one of her children.

loans.use: to buy four dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a roof for his house to make it ready for living.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a 31-year-old woman, who is unmarried and has three children. She runs a mechanic shop and has been serving Samoa for over two years. Luisa needs a loan to buy a new taxi and some very much-needed auto tools for the shop. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. Luisa joined SPBD in 2009, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi and some tools for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and propagate

loans.name: Mawia

texts.en:
Mawia is a 23-year-old, single man, living with his family in Hodeidah city, Yemen. He has a University education, but he couldn't find a job to look after his family. He lives with his family in a very miserable condition. Mawia works hard to improve the living conditions of his family. He works as a driver, on a motorcycle that belongs to his friend, with a daily pay. That money which he receives from that work is not enough to cover the needs of Mawia's family. He thinks that, if he had his own motorcycle to work on, as a driver to transport people from one place to another, he would earn a good amount of money. Mawia does not have enough money to purchase that. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 155,000 YER from AMB, which he will use in order to purchase a motorcycle, to work on it as a driver.

Mawia hopes to purchase a bus, to work on it as a driver. In that way, he would earn a lot of money that would help him in making a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle to drive, rather than working for a daily pay with someone else's motorcycle

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 20-year-old single man, living with his family in Hodeidah City, Yemen. He studied up to Secondary education but he couldn't complete his study. He is from an extremely poor family in Hodiedah. Nabil has a great determination to provide his family with suitable living standards. From this side, Nabil decided to work as a driver on a motorcycle of his friend with a daily pay. That pay is not enough to cover the necessary needs of his family. In order to earn a good amount of money, Nabil decided to purchase a motorcycle to work on as a driver to transport people from one place to another inside the city. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 155,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle to work on it as a driver to transport people.

In future, Nabil hopes to purchase another motorcycle and rent it out for a monthly salary.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to work on it as a driver to transport people.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is 25 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for three years. Sofia needs a loan to buy handicrafts, elei printed material, shoes, kava bowls and a variety of Samoan-made jewelry. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, elei printed material, shoes, kava bowls and a variety of Samoan-made jewelry.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 40-year-old married man and father of seven children, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. Abdullah's house lacks of a lot of furniture and home appliances and most of what is there is very old. All the members of the family feel inconvenienced because of the miserable condition inside the house. Abdullah works hard to improve the living condition of the house, but his income is not enough to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase furniture and home appliances for his house.

Abdullah looks forward to providing his family with a good future. He hopes to send his children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase phone recharge cards to distribute to call centers and groceries

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en:
Fialelei is 24 years old and single with one child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. 

Fialelei has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs, and rubber designs

loans.name: Uataliatalosaga

texts.en:
Uataliatalosaga is a 27-year-old woman who is unmarried with one child. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has one year with this business. 

Uataliatalosaga needs a loan to buy new tyres and a taxi sign and to pay for her taxi's registration fee. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Uataliatalosaga joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres and a taxi sign and to pay for her taxi's registration fee

loans.name: Taligalu

texts.en:
Taligalu is a 28-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one1 year of experience with this business. 

Taligalu needs a loan to buy sugar, cordials, a chest freezer, a large spoon, a cooler, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taligalu has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordials, a chest freezer, a large spoon, a cooler, and foam cups

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina is a 20-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Susitina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly needs. Susitina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 35-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a bus service business to earn an income. She has two years with this business. Theresa needs a loan to pay for her bus's registration fee and also buy two second-hand tyres. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Theresa joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for her bus's registration fee and buy two second-hand tyres.

loans.name: Maa Bastaren Group

texts.en:
Madhu, an active married lady of 33 years, is a permanent resident of Sangamada village in Boalngir district of Odisha, India. She is standing third from the right with her raised hand in the photo.  This village is located in an interior area with a distance of 130 kilometer from the district headquarters. Most of the families of this village belongs to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) class and depend on traditional paddy cultivation. Madhu hails from a traditional potter family. She resides in a nuclear family with her husband and one son of 18 months.

Due to not much income from her conventional work of making and selling earthen pots, Madhu has given up the same and for the last six years, she has been running a general shop with ladies fancy items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, etc. and daily use items like potatoes, onions, sugar, tea, soap, etc. in her house. Apart from this, her husband procures paddy and other seasonal cereals by moving to different weekly markets, which he sells in the off season to get some extra income. Presently, Madhu is earning a monthly income of 4,000 INR and at any rate, is managing her family. But she has a dream to come out from this paucity cycle and earn more to establish herself well in society. So she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase the income. This year, Madhu, along with 12 other like-minded women of her village, formed a group named Maa Bastaren and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. With this loan of 16,000 INR, she wants to purchase more items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, potatoes, onions, sugar, tea, soap, etc. Looking into the market situation of the village, she is very hopeful that this investment will help her to earn some extra income and by saving something, she will be able to construct a good cabin for her business and thinks of a better future for her child.

The other 12 members of this group are doing different types of business like milk-selling, a general store, an auto-repair center, tailoring etc. and wish to develop their enterprises from this loan.

loans.use: To pay for items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, potatoes, onion, sugar, tea, and soap for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase loose materials such as sand and  cement to renovate the inside of his house

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a 70-year-old widow with three children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Fialelei needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Fialelei has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro was born in 1996. She is a very young and industrious woman. Zuhro is not married and lives with her parents in the country. She successfully graduated school and now she is going to start a business. She is able to sew women's national dresses and that’s how she plans to realize her abilities. She will serve clients in her house. 

Zuhro studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at the women's organization and got useful information for herself. She is asking for a loan of 900 TJS to buy fabrics for setting up her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for setting up her new sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Roselyn requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Roselyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cellestial

texts.en:
Cellestrial is a 20-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Cellestial needs a loan to buy a large cooler, a chest freezer, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups, and Chinese candy. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses. Cellestial has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a large cooler, a chest freezer, cordials, bags of sugar, foam cups, and Chinese candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, crops, a shovel, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and new boots

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en:
Vaimaila is a 36-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Vaimaila has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors, and material

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en: Maseiga is 48 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for eight years. Maseiga needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Maseiga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade.

loans.name: Joshlyn

texts.en:
Joshlyn has created a brand that refuses to go quietly into the night. In her words, the Write Fit is about creative expression, drawing inspiration from greeting cards as well as from a variety of sources in fashion stretching back to when she used to visit vintage stores with her Grandmother. 

In short, the Write Fit is a “lifestyle brand” that does not use the phrase frivolously, with products broken up into categories in order to satisfy diverse client demographics ranging from religious observers to the gay community.

Though her business has been profitable for a while now, Joshlyn will tell you that in business “something always comes up.” For her, the difficulties are often financial, with recent concerns centering on her ability to secure liquidity for future inventory purchases. 

She will use her Kiva loan on just that, including restocking costs for several popular designs that sold out after being promoted by popular Instagrammers. 

\With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Joshlyn will continue her current dual trajectory toward financial stability and artistic expression.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of the most popular designs

loans.name: Ceveriana

texts.es:
Ceveriana de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado. El esposo, es agricultor y son padres de 11 hijos. Su esposo junto a sus hijos trabajan en las fincas, también cultivan café. Trabajan para el bien de la familia, desde pequeña se dedica a la elaboración de tamales típicos y al trabajo de la finca, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, debido a que representaba la única fuente de ingresos para la familia. 

 El préstamo que está solicitando, es para limpiar la finca (poda, peina y desombra) y otra parte para gastos de graduación de noveno grado de una de sus hijas y por el esfuerzo y dedicación que ella a demostrado le quiere hacer un almuerzo para agasajarla y así se motive a seguir estudiando. 

Su sueño es seguir cultivando más café, ya que considera que obtiene mejores ingresos, para su futuro espera buena salud, para sus hijos bendición, con el dinero de crédito piensa que se le ayuda mucho pues no cuenta con dinero para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Ceveriana is 57 years old and studied through first grade. Her husband is a farmer and they are the parents of 11 children. Her husband and her children work on the farms and also grow coffee. They work for the well being of the family. From a young age, Ceveriana made a living making typical tamales and working on the farm, work that she learned from her parents given that it was the only source of income for her family. 

The loan she is requesting is to restore the farm (pruning, raking and clearing out) and another part of it is to pay for the expenses of one of her daughter's ninth grade graduation. For the effort and dedication her daughter has shown, she would like to give her a lunch to honor her and to motivate her to continue studying.

Her dream is to continue growing more coffee since she considers that her best way to earn a better income. For her future, she hopes for good health and blessings for her children. She believes the loan money will be a great help to her since she does not have the money for the work.

loans.use: to restore the farm (pruning, raking and clearing out) and another part of it to pay for the expenses of one of her daughter's ninth grade graduation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive for hire

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun’s parents brought her to the US when she was just a young girl, seeking a better opportunity for the whole family.  Struggling to find a true calling, Noeun joined the military and served her country for several years. 

During this time, she not only gained financial stability and met her fiancé, she also learned skills and characteristics that would prove essential in her future endeavors as an entrepreneur. The brave men and women who dedicate themselves to protect our country not only receive educational support upon exiting the military, they are also equipped with discipline, hard work ethic, problem solving skills and dedication; essential skills for a budding entrepreneur.  

Noeun decided soon after her discharge, to pursue a career in Oriental Medicine. She wanted a career that provided her an opportunity to improve people’s lives, and better their health. 

After spending over four years in school, she is ready to pursue her own practice. Noeun now has a space rented, but is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase some essential equipment and supplies in order to practice at her highest level and provide the best services to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase some essential equipment and supplies to open her acupuncture clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish clothes to resell

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en: Soifua is 53 years old and single with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 9 years. Soifua needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, crops, a machete and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Soifua will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, crops, a machete and a watering hose

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela is a 67-year-old widow with 6 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Rasela needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Rasela has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more food items for her grocery store in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Siufaga

texts.en: Siufaga is a 32-year-old unmarried woman with 2 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Siufaga needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, rubber gloves and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Siufaga has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, rubber gloves and foam cups

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion. She has has been preparing and selling tortillas for several years. Her business is located at her home and she has many customers.

Vilma is requesting a loan in order to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder so that she can continue preparing tortillas. As a result, she can earn a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, iron steels, bricks, and gravel to complete the building of the house and to renovate the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish clothes to resell

loans.name: Thanh Yen 1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh, 32, is a mom of two children, ages 12 and 13. She works in agricultural production while her husband works for the construction employer in a dangerous environment to have extra income. To have enough income to cover living expenses for the family as well as pay tuition fees for the kids, Mrs. Linh has diversified production into various activities, including growing rice, vegetables and coffee as well as breeding pigs and chickens. Therefore, she has taken out loans from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough capital for the investment. This is the second time she has received the loan and she will use it to buy food for the pigs and chickens. 

Mrs. Linh has worked at cultivation and animal husbandry since she was very little, so she believes that, with her experience in agriculture together with the support from the program, including training and counseling, her investment will go well and generate high income for her family. 

Mrs. Linh dreams that her children will go to good colleges, have good jobs, and have an abundant life. In the picture, she wears the horizontal striped shirt and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya has her own business. For eleven years she has been selling men’s shoes at the market. 

The previous loan helped Zoya to increase the assortment of shoes and get new clients. Zoya is a very active and hardworking person. She wants to develop her business further. 

Zoya is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH to buy men's shoes for the winter season. She is planning to get a bigger income and continue to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes for the winter season

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 35 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Элмиры - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2008 году, благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы и 3 бычка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и завершение строительства теплого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Elmira is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  In order to provide her family with an additional source of income, she has been raising livestock since 2008.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two dairy cows and three young bulls.  She makes a monthly income of 13,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some bull calves for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her herd and to finish building a heated barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy additional bull-calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel lives in Dili, and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $600 (USD) from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

Isabel has her business shop in her house, so many people come to buy every day. Isabel has been involved in business activities since in 2010, which she started with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income from her business, so she is still happy to do her business. 

Isabel is taking this loan because she wants to add more goods to her store including medicine, biscuits, instant noodles, balm, cigarettes, candy, slippers, shampoo, detergent, coffee, curry and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy medicine, biscuits, instant noodles, balm, cigarettes, candy, slippers, shampoo, detergent, coffee, curry and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his oldest child to work as a driver.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang, 36, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. To make a living, she has invested in a business of selling vegetables in Phnom Penh City. So far, she has been in this career for almost ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day.

Her business is running very well so she wishes to extend her business by serving a variety of vegetables. However, her current capital investment doesn't allow her to do so. Thus, she is now applying a KIVA loan to buy additional vegetables to supply her customers’ demand. She hopes this loan will help her business succeed.  She also thanks to all the lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia works hard to support her family. Eufemia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Eufemia requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and ingredients for her food vending business.

Eufemia has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 39 years old and has five children. Elma is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elma has been farming corn for eight years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business selling food supplements in the Philippines.

Amalia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of food supplements to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for  years now.

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of food supplements to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, shirts, short-sleeved shirts, long-sleeved shirts, children's clothes and other clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including toothpaste, clothes brushes, ketchup, sauce, sardines, cooking oils, sugar, coffee, detergent, eggs, noodles, shampoo, candies, milk and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $480.00. She wants to open a big store in the future so she has one idea of taking this loan to improve her business with good management. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin so that she can have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, clothes brushes, ketchup, sauce, sardines, cooking oils, sugar, coffee, detergent, eggs, noodles, shampoo, candies, milk and other things to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional  income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Daisy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estrellita is 44 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Estrellita has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Estrellita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Estrellita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mardilyn

texts.en:
Mardilyn is 40 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mardilyn has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines. Mardilyn requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like deodorant, lotion, bags, lipsticks, and body spray to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mardilyn has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Mardilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like deodorant, lotion, bags, lipsticks, and body spray to sell

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.ru: Кульмира, 52 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. Кульмира на протяжении 4 лет занимается заготовкой и реализацией сельскохозяйственной продукции. У нее в доме есть погреб, вместимостью 20 тонн, Кульмира осенью закупает у местного населения картофель и на протяжении всего года перепродает по более высокой цене, уже заготовленно 13 тонн. Средства от перепродажи - единственный источник дохода для Кульмиры. В связи с приближающимся зимним периодом, Кульмира хочет докупить еще картофеля для перепродажи, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS). Это позволит Кульмире увеличить товарооборот экологически чистого, вкусного картофеля, получить прибыль и накопить на покупку необходимого в бизнесе грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Kulmira is 52, married, and has two children.  She's earned her living buying and selling produce for the past four years; there's a cellar at her house that holds 20 metric tons of goods, and she uses it to stock up on potatoes from local farmers in the fall and resell them for a profit throughout the year.  At the moment, Kulmira has 13 metric tons of potatoes in storage.  This is Kulmira's only source of income, and she'd like to increase her stock of potatoes before winter sets in.  As such, she's seeking a loan of 65,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank, which will allow her to sell more tasty organic potatoes and have extra money to put towards a new shipping truck she needs for her business.

loans.use: stock up on organic potatoes for resale to increase turnover

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en: Terezinha lives in Dili.  She is married and she has three children. She has been involved in business activities since 2004. She started with her own working capital of $100. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more second hand clothes such as shirts, trousers, shorts and other clothes to sell. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hayat Al- Kadef Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hayat Al- Kadef. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. 

Sa'ada is 54 years old and married woman with five children. She is an uneducated woman, but works hard to improve the living conditions of her family. She has a strong determination to go ahead. In the beginning, Sa'ada started her own business with a small amount of money, which she saved up selling makeup, accessories and perfumes in order to help her husband cover the expenses of the family. The income of her husband is unfixed and very limited. Sa'ada believes this business as a profitable for her, but most of what she earns goes to cover the expenses of her family. She wants to expand her business more. As a result, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, perfumes, cosmetics and other items to be able to meet all the demands of her customers.


Sa'ada expects a boost in her income. She hopes to open a shop for selling all the women accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, perfumes, cosmetics and other items.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 54 years old and the widowed mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Shirley has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Shirley has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and paint.

loans.name: Cubaka Group

texts.fr: Madame NSIMIRE est mariée à un électricien et mère de 10 enfants. A l’âge de 44 ans, elle assume la fonction de conseillère au sein du groupe de crédit CUBAKA. Elle est vendeuse des produits divers depuis 1996 grâce au premier fonds reçu de son mari. Avec le nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 200kgs de farine, 1 bidon d’hile et 5kgs de fretin. Son objectif est de scolariser ses enfants et construire sa maison. Elle remercie ainsi HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: NSIMIRE is married to an electrician and she has ten children.  She is 44 years old and serves as an adviser within the CUBAKA credit group.  Thanks to an initial capital received from her husband, she has been selling various goods since 1996.  She will use this loan to buy 200 kilos of flour, one can of oil and five kilos of small fish.  Her goal is to send her children to school and to build her own house.  She thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilos of flour, one can of oil and five kilos of small fish.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 61 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Restituta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Restituta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a married with four children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cesar is 60 years old.

Cesar has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Cesar requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

Cesar has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Cesar would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexanders grows early and late vegetables in greenhouses. Due to a previous loan, he installed the heating system in the greenhouse for his seedlings. Also, he bought a tractor to till the ground and take out vegetables for sale.

His income increased a little compared to the previous year, but prices are rising much faster. That's why Alexander needs additional resources.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to buy coal for the heating system. He installed a good heating system, but it doesn't make sense without a coal. Alexander has to buy coal, regardless of price, and the earlier he can do it, the better the price.

loans.use: to buy coal for his greenhouse heating system.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has a three-year old daughter. Alexander has his own business.

Alexander has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for ten years. He grows early and late cucumbers and tomatoes. Alexander is a very hardworking person. He wants to develop his business further.

Alexander is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to install a heating system and build an additional greenhouse. Loan will help him to get a bigger harvest in the spring and make additional income for his family.

loans.use: to install a heating system and build an additional greenhouse.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. Imelda is married and owns a Jeepney. For a living, she engaged in buying and selling firewood using the Jeepney with her husband as the driver, and also providing transport to local community members. Imelda has been doing this for 12 years. 

Recently, she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance expenses of her Jeepney for continuous operation. Imelda is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Imelda hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance expenses of her Jeepney for continuous operation

loans.name: Amorita

texts.en:
Amorita is 55 years old and married.  She has eight children, and three of them are still in school.

Amorita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Amorita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Amorita has been in the pig fattening business for 21 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amorita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand his house and to renovate the old side of it.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, 40, is the mother of two grown-up children at the ages of 20 and 22. She lives with her children in a small village where people mainly work in agricultural production and her family is not an exception. Indeed, their major source of income is from cultivation; breeding chickens, ducks and pigs. Her children, though, have graduated from college, but have still faced unemployment. For that reason, Mrs. Phuong wants to expand her animal husbandry to ensure enough income for living expenses as well as create work for her grown-up children before they could find other better jobs. Thus, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and hopes that, with the training and counselling about raising pigs from the program, she will earn a high income. 

Mrs. Phuong hopes her children will soon get a good job and have better living conditions. Phuong stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 58 years old and married with eleven children. With three children still in school, Digna works very hard to provide for them.

Digna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Digna has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, candies, etc. 

In the future, Digna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, born in 1985, is a Thai woman. She has been participating in the program since January 1995. She lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding coffee trees. Each harvest, her family can earn 30-40 million VND. It is just enough to buy food and save a small amount but it is not enough to buy fertilizer for coffee trees. Therefore, she really needs to borrow a loan for the purpose.

She hopes the loan will help her family to invest effectively, and the coming coffee harvest will have higher productivity, and that it will partly improve her family life well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes in greenhouses. She has four large greenhouses and one greenhouse for seedlings. 

Due to a previous loan, Natalya installed the heating system in all greenhouses. Family income had doubled, but in autumn there was a big storm. A few greenhouses had some damage.

Now, Natalya is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to repair greenhouses and buy coal. Because of the situation in Donbass, coal prices increased very much. Using a loan, Natalya hopes to buy coal for the spring harvest.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouses and buy coal.

loans.name: Angelou

texts.en:
Angelou is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. 

Recently, Angelou requested a loan to purchase bags of of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion.  Someday Angelou hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income

loans.name: Sreychou

texts.en:
SreyChou, 35, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children who are currently in school. She is a garment factory worker with a daily income of USD 2.00. Apart from being a factory worker, she also owns a small field of corn plants which are now big enough to harvest.

To accelerate the harvest, she would have some people to assist her in the harvesting process yet she doesn't have sufficient money to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply a KIVA loan to pay for hiring laborers. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers

loans.name: Vang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vang, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic women. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in the Mai Son district, Son La province.  Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding. Life is still hard but she tries to work hard to give her daughter a good enough condition for her education.  

Currently, Mrs. Vang needs to pay her daughter’s tuition, but she doesn't have enough money.  She really wants to borrow a loan through the M7-MFI program to support her family and reduce their difficulty at this time.  She expects much of this loan will help her daughter have the chance to go to school to get more knowledge in preparation for her life in the future.

loans.use: to help her daughter have the chance to go to school

loans.name: Edissa

texts.en:
Edissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines.

Edissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her business.  She has been in this business for two years now.

Edissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: A $800 loan is offered to Virgina to improve her business. Virgina lives in Dili. Most of her daily income is from selling clothes, and because many people come to buy her clothes every day, she is still happy to do her business. She started her business in 2006, with her own working capital of $1,000. She will use this money to add to her principal amount to buy more clothes, pants, sweatpants, t-shirts, dresses and other women's clothes to sell, according to what people like. She is happy to be offered the loan from Tuba Rai Metin so that she can have more working capital to buy more clothes. Virginia is taking this loan because she wants to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, sweatpants, t-shirts, dresses and other women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married. He has two young sons. Yuriy used to work in the fire service for many years. After he retired Yuriy was able to develop his business he's had for many years.

Yuriy has been growing cucumbers and tomatoes in greenhouses for 18 years. Today, he has 7 heated greenhouses. Yuriy is a hardworking person. Everything is very clean outside and inside of the house. Yuriy has unused land where he plans to build more greenhouses.

Last year, Yuriy built two new greenhouses and now he wants to install a heating system there. He is asking for a loan of 40,000 UAH for the heating system.

loans.use: to install a heating system in two new greenhouses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old and married.  She has five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her business.

Erlinda has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh was born in 1982, and is a Kinh woman. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Mrs. Anh's main occupation is cultivation and animal breeding.  To have more income in order to improve her family’s lives, she plans to expand her sow for breeding and their meat, but money is limited. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan from the program to invest in breeding.  Mrs. Anh hopes that through the loan, it will help her family create good conditions for breeding, and that then their income will increase.

loans.use: to invest in breeding

loans.name: Glena

texts.en:
Glena, 49 years old, is married and a resident of Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years now.

Since Glena wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In June 2012 both Rosalinda and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to request a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. Aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. Glena has now applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale to generate more income. 

Glena is wishing that with Paglaum’s help and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale to generate more income

loans.name: Nicalosa

texts.en:
Nicalosa is 62 years old and a widowed mother of five children.  

Nicalosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nicalosa has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 32 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nicalosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Glycen

texts.en:
Glycen is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Glycen works very hard to provide for them.

Glycen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Glycen has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Glycen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stella Marie

texts.en:
Stella Marie is 16 years old and is the third of three children in the family. Her mother, Bernadith, supports the family through her manufacturing business in the Philippines.

Stella Marie is studying as a Bachelor of Secondary Education major in Mathematics and is currently in the first of this four-year course.

Stella Marie is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When she graduates, Stella Marie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gregoria is 44 years old, and two children are currently in school.

Gregoria has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Gregoria requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Gregoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nhat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhat, born in 1979, is a Kinh woman. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. Both of her children are good at learning; her eldest son is studying at a high school in Mai Son district, and the other one is studying at primary school.

The main income for Mrs. Nhat's family is from agricultural production. It is just enough to cover food and save a small amount. Mrs. Nhat wants to invest in her children’s education and pay for the tuition, but she does not have enough. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.  Mrs. Nhat hopes that the loan she borrows will partly help her children have better conditions for studying, and she will work hard to get money to repay the M7-MFI loan on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education and pay for the tuition

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, born in 1982, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s occupation is breeding and cultivation. Income from cultivation and breeding after deducting all expenses is just enough for covering food and saving a little amount. But, it is not enough to buy breeding livestock and food for it. Therefore, she really wants to borrow a loan to expand goat raising, and geese and chicken. 
 
She expects, thanks to the loan borrowed, it will help her family to invest effectively in livestock breeding; next year will bring her family more advantages and partly improve her family’s life. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to invest in breeding

loans.name: Chandee

texts.en:
Chandee is a very dedicated man who wants to become successful in the future. He is studying to be a Seafarer in a university. His parents are earning from farming and earn a good income that was able to support their family and his studies. He has six siblings, and one of them is already married. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, he wants to become successful with his family and be able to get a stable job for a better future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 47-year-old married woman who has been selling "tuba" (native coconut wine) with the help of her husband, who also works as a carpenter. The couple earns well from this business and wants to buy additional stock to sell in the town market. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing more stock of coconut wine.
 
She is a responsible mother of four children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. She took a new loan recently to buy more native wine to deliver it in the market in town as a supplier. She wishes to utilize her earned profit to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more native wine to deliver in the market in town as a supplier.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family. Genalyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Genalyn requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genalyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Noi, born in 1979, is a Thai ethnic person. She lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. Both of her two children are obedient and good at learning. Her eldest daughter is studying at high school, and her son is studying at secondary school.

Her family’s main occupation is a small business, so the income is just enough for buying food and a little left over. She wants to invest in her children’s education and pay for the tuition, but she doesn’t have enough. Therefore, she needs to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes this loan will help her invest well in her children’s education and bring them a bright future. She will work hard to get money to repay the M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education and pay for the tuition

loans.name: Kathlene

texts.en:
Kathlene is 32 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Kathlene works very hard to provide for the family.

Kathlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, cereals, seasonings, noodles, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Kathlene has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, seasonings, noodles, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. 

Kathlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, cereals, seasonings, noodles, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Chanmonyra

texts.en:
Chanmonyra is a 28-year-old married woman with three young children. She lives in Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. Since 2012 she has been employed as a garment-factory worker earning approximately $5 per day. Two of her children attend school. 

Chanmonyra's husband is 31 years old and he buys drums to resell, earning $7 a day. To help improve her husband’s business, Chanmonyra would like to apply for a loan for her husband to buy more drums to resell. With the loan, her husband will earn more income. 

For her future plans, she is going to help her children to finish high school, and she also wants to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy more drums to resell in her husband's business

loans.name: La

texts.en:
38-year-old La from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, is an experienced and active farmer. She is a single lady who owns a small cassava field. Through running her farming business, she can earn around USD 2.50 per day to support her living expenses. She has been working as a farmer for around twenty years. 

To keep her cassava growing well, La is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because she has a shortage of working capital, she has asked for a KIVA loan through KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can make her cassava grow better and produce more crops. She sends thanks to all KIVA lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marilynn

texts.en:
Marilynn has run her rented beauty salon for two years. She is 40 years old, and married with one child. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). Marilynn also works in the hog-raising business for an additional source of income.

She would like to keep her beauty salon business profitable, so she has asked for a loan of 50,000 Philipines Pesos (PHP), which allows her to buy new supplies like a curling iron, a new chair and chemicals for hair rebonding. She hopes that she can use this loan to further grow her beauty salon business.

In the picture, Marilynn is the lady in the blue t-shirt. The other people around her are customers and a helper.

loans.use: to buy new materials needed for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Esteria is 53 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with 6 adult children. 

Esteria has a shop that sells charcoal, straw and bananas, and she has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan to pay for 5 sacks of charcoal to sell for more income. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

In the future, Esteria hopes to have a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 5 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a woman who searches for any possible way to get resources that will allow her to feed her family. 

She has successfully repaid a previous loan, which she used to buy inventory for resale. She is now earning more income from her investments, and also buying copra (dried coconut kernels) in bulk to resell in town. 

Perlita has asked for this current loan to finance her copra buy-and-sell business.  By the grace of God, she is always able to look out for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to finance her copra buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Crinalyn

texts.en:
Crinalyn is 18 years old and is the first of two children in the family. Her mother, Porferia, supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

Crinalyn is studying Bachelor of Elementary Education and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014 - 2015.

In the future Crinalyn plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 58 years old and married with three children.

Ludivina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ludivina has asked for a 19,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ludivina has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Ludivina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in her home, to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Fe Claire

texts.en:
Fe Claire is 19 years old and is the fourth of five children in the family. Her mother, Mariana Rita, supports the family through her agriculture business in the Philippines.

Fe Claire is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014 - 2015.

In the future, Fe Claire plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Leni

texts.pt:
O senhor Leni e seguranca de 35 anos de idade, pai de 2 filhos estes a frequentarem o ensino primario vive na casa propria.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco para ampliar a sua casa .
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia e quer tambem construir uma barraca para aumentar a renda familiar.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Leni is a 35-year-old security guard and a father of two children, who are in primary school. He lives in his own house.

He says that he will use this loan to buy sand, stones, and metal sheets to expand his house. In terms of his projects for the future, he would like to expand his house to offer a better home to his family. He also wants to build a stand to increase the family's income.

He says that he is committed to making his payments on time and coming back to request more loans.

loans.use: to buy sand, stones, and metal sheets.

loans.name: Justino

texts.pt:
O senhor Justino de 40 anos de idade e casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequenta o ensino primario e 2 o ensino secundario.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco tinta e pagar a mao de obra para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro consiste em ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia, e fazer  faculdade.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorrido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Justino is 40 years old and married. He is a father of three children, of whom two are in primary school and one is in secondary school.

He says that he will use this loan to buy sand, stone, metal sheets, and paint, as well as to pay workers to continue construction. His project for the future is to expand his house to give his family a better home. He would also like to go to university.

He says that he is committed to making his payments on time and coming back to request more loans so he can achieve his dreams. He has also called on family "xitiques" (traditional savings groups) to overcome some difficulties.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, metal sheets, and paint.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
A senhora  Joana de 36 anos de idade e solteira mae de de 1 filha que frequenta o ensino primario vive tambem com a mae esta que se encontra na sua responsabilidade.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia,cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco, ferros, para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Seus Projectos para o futuro e ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia, deseja tambem casar se.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorrido tambem a xitiques familiares para suprir algumas dificuldades.
texts.en:
Joana, 36, is a single mother of one daughter, who is in primary school. She also lives with her mother, who is under her responsibility.

She says that she will use this loan to buy sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, and iron rods to continue her construction work. Her project for the future is to expand her house to give her family a better home. She would also like to get married.

She says that she is committed to making her payments on time and coming back to request more loans so she can achieve her dreams. She has also called upon family "xitiques" (traditional savings groups) to overcome some difficulties.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, and iron rods.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O senhor Carlos de 50 anos de idade e casado pai de 5 filhos dos quais 1 ja independente vive em casa propria 4 frequenta o ensino primario.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar uma geleira e um microonda para aumentar os bens da sua casa.
Seus Projectos para o futuro e ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia, e abrir um negocio para aumentar a renda familiar.
O cliente promete pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos e que tem recorido tambem a xitiques familiares para responder a certas necessidades.
texts.en:
Carlos, 50, is married and a father to five children. One of his children is already independent and lives in their own house, and the other four are in primary school. He says that he will use this loan to buy a refrigerator and a microwave to increase the assets of his home.

His projects for the future are to expand his house to offer a better home to his family and to open a business to increase his family's income. He promises to make his payments on time and come back to request more loans to achieve his dreams. He has also called upon family "xitiques" (traditional savings groups) to respond to certain needs.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a microwave.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
O senhor Augusto de 39 anos de idade e casado pai de 4 filhos que frequentam o ensino primario vive na casa propria.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco, tinta,blocos,porta,janelas e pagar a mao de obra para dar continuidade  a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro quer ampliar sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua familia, deseja tambem construir mais dependencias para aumentar a renda familiar.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para poder alcancar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Augusto, 39, is married and a father of four children, who are in primary school. He lives in his own house.

He says that he will use this loan to buy sand, stone, zinc sheets, paint, blocks, a door, and windows as well as to pay workers to continue construction. His projects for the future are to expand his house to give his family a better home and to build more apartments to increase his family's income.

He says that he is committed to making his payments on time and coming back to request more loans so he can achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, zinc sheets, paint, blocks, a door and windows.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A senhora Virginia e vigilante  tem 48 anos de idade, mae solteira de 1 filha  ja maior de idade  e casada vive na casa propria e sustenta um neto que vive com ela.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco para varroes, janelas, sanita para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Projectos para o futuro  terminar a construcao de sua casa fazer dependencias para arrendar reforcando a sua renda e instalar agua canalizada.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Virginia, 48, is a single mother of one daughter. Her daughter is already an adult and married. She lives in her own house and takes care of a grandson who lives with her.

She says that she will use this loan to buy sand, stone, sheets of zinc for rails, windows, and a toilet to continue her construction work. Her projects for the future are to finish construction on her house and to build apartments to rent out, reinforcing her income. She would also like to install piped water. 

She says that she is committed to making her payments on time and coming back to request more loans to fulfill her plans.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, sheets of zinc for rails, windows, and a toilet.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar cuenta con dos hijos: el primero de 7 años de edad y es estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad, el segundo de 2 años de edad  que aun no estudia, el es un hombre emprendedor que no le importa qué actividad realizar sino lo único que a el le importa es tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa casual en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que el a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de jornalero en su comunidad y por medio de esa actividad el puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

El es muy emprendedor en la vida y es por ello que el se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa casual, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

La aspiración más importante de el es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Cesar has two children: the first one is 7 years old and studies in his community. The second one is 2 years old and is not studying yet. He is an enterprising man who does not mind what type of work he performs as long as it brings financial income for the benefit of his family. His work is buying and selling informal clothing because it is the only way he has found to have financial income for his family. His second job is as a daily laborer in his community. Through this means he can have another extra income to support his family and give his children an appropriate life so they are good professionals in life. He is very enterprising in life, and therefore, he applied to a loan to buy merchandise of casual clothing. This way he will have more merchandise available for sale for his customers. His more important goal is to build a better house and give his children good education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of casual clothing.

loans.name: Chela

texts.es:
Chela tiene 42 años de edad y se sigue dedicando a su venta de cerveza. Ella vende la cerveza desde su depósito y trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. la socia ya lleva 7 años en este negocio y ha crecido mucho. Su sueño profesional es ampliar el negocio de venta de cerveza. La socia solicita el crédito nuevo para comprar cerveza al por mayor.
La socia esta muy agradecido por ser un cliente de Arariwa y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Chela is 42 years old. She continues to sell beer. She sells beer from her store and works from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years and it has grown a lot. Her professional dream is to expand the beer selling business. She is asking for the new loan to buy beer wholesale. 

She is grateful to be a client of Arariwa and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
BENKAN est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de NANA qui est la seule personne assise sur la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE dans la  sous-préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités  vente dans le restaurant : riz, haricot et viande. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. 
NANA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TIELE, excelle de la vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac de haricot et une quantité importante de viande pour leur restaurant. Elle s’approvisionne à TIELE et dans les villages environnant. Elle  vend ses aliments à TIELE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans son activité vente dans le restaurant.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is part of the Benkadi de Tièle association. It groups together women who got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships. They have an average age of 28, are married and have, on average, 3 children. They all have different businesses such as selling food in a restaurant, like Nana, who is the only person sitting down in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in Tièle, in the sub-prefecture of Baguineda (Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali). They have been small retailers for several years and the food they sell in the restaurant (rice, beans and meat) is very much in demand. In order to be able to meet the needs of their growing clientele, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program 6 years ago. This is their 8th group loan.

Nana, the group leader, is very well known in Tièle and her restaurant business is very successful. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of beans and a large quantity of meat for their restaurant. She gets her supplies in Tièle and the surrounding villages. She sells her food in Tièle, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30 000 francs, an amount which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of beans and a large quantity of meat.

loans.name: Carlota Irma

texts.es:
Carlota se dedica a su negocio de pan panadería. Ella se levanta muy tempranito de la mañana para preparar sus panes. Despues, se va a venderlos en las diferentes calles de Cusco. Usualmente la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 AM hasta las 5:00 OM.  Ya lleva siete anos en este panadería y sigue trabajando duro para cumplir su sueño de crecer su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito para comprar los insumos para el pan como menteca, azúcar, harina, y mantequilla. 

Carlota se siente muy feliz por ser cliente de Arariwa y por tener acceso al financiamiento. Ella ha comprometido a cumplir con sus cuotas de una manera ordenada.
texts.en:
Carlota is dedicated to her bread bakery business. She rises very early in the morning to prepare the breads. Later, she travels around the different streets of Cusco to sell them. Usually, she works from 8AM until 5PM. She already has seven years experience with this bakery and she keeps working hard to accomplish her dream of growing her business. She is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients for the bread such as butter, sugar, flour and shortening.

Carlota feels happy about being a client of Arariwa and to have access to financing. She has promised to make her payments in an orderly manner.

loans.use: to buy butter, flour, and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel sigue dedicandose a su negocio de venta de comida típica peruana. Ella prepara ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limón y salchipapas que es un plato a base de salchichas con papas. Ella vende el ceviche en las mañanas y en las noches vende las salchipapas. Maribel se ha dedicado a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien. Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante algún dia. La socia solicita este crédito para comprar los ingredientes como pescado, limón, salchichas y papas.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maribel continues dedicating herself to her business selling typical Peruvian food. She prepares ceviche, which is a fish-based dish with lemon, and salchipapas, which is a dish of sausages and potatoes. She sells ceviche in the mornings and, at night, sells salchipapas. Maribel has been dedicated to this business for five years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have her own restaurant one day. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients such as fish, lemon, sausages and potatoes.

The member is very thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy fish and lemons and also to buy sausages and potatoes.

loans.name: Dan Jeovha

texts.es:
Dan es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene una maravillosa familia conformada por su esposa y su pequeño hijo quienes son lo mejor que le ha pasado en la vida. Él hubiera querido estudiar una profesión, pero como sus padres no tenían buenas oportunidades económicas no pudo hacerlo, es por ello que lucha día a día para poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo porque quiere que él si pueda seguir una carrera universitaria. Trabaja en una empresa prestigiosa como empleado y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y gran responsabilidad con la que asume cada tarea.
Dan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su cuarto como pintarrajear las paredes y comprar un juego de dormitorio, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y continuará esforzándose para brindarles mayor bienestar cada día.
texts.en:
