Dan is a young man who really wants to get ahead. He has a wonderful family made up of his wife and their little son. They are the best thing that has happened to him in his life. He would have liked to go to college, but since his parents didn't have good economic opportunities he wasn't able to do it. That is why he fights day to day to be able to offer a good future to his son because he wants his to be able to go to college. He works in a prestigious business as an employee and he thinks it is going well for him because of his good performance and the great responsibility he takes with every task. 

Dan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered he will be able to make improvements on his room, like daub the walls and buy a bedroom set. This way, he can improve the quality of life is his loved ones. He will continue striving to offer them more well being every day.

loans.use: to reinforce his walls and buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia works hard to support her family. Ma. Cecelia is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Ma. Cecelia requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Ma. Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
Maria Lucy todavia se dedica al negocio de panadería donde produce diferentes tipos de pan.  Ella desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, y vende sus panes en los mercados locales en Cusco. Maria Lucy ya tiene mas que 6 anos estar en su negocio y le va bien. Su sueño es poder tener su propio local donde pueda vender los panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para cobrar los insumos típicos del pan como harina, mantequilla, y huevos. 

La socia está muy agradecido de ser cliente de Arariwa y tener acceso al crédito. Ademas, se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria Lucy is still dedicated to her bakery business where she produces different types of bread. She works from 8AM until 7PM and sells her breads in the local markets of Cusco. Maria Lucy has more than six years experience in her business and it is going well. Her dream is to be able to have her own shop where she can sell her breads. She is requesting the loan to buy typical ingredients for bread like flour, butter and eggs.

The member is very thankful to be a client of Arariwa and to have access to the loan. Additionally, she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, and eggs at wholesale price.

loans.name: Tony

texts.es:
Tony es una persona muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace varios años trabaja como empleado en una gran empresa de su ciudad natal, Irazola. en sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar fútbol con sus amigos y salir a pasear con sus familiares. Es una persona muy amable y trabajador, siempre preocupándose por brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
Tony está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su casa como reforzar las paredes y pintar la fachada, de esta manera sus padres y hermanos se sentirán más cómodos y seguros y así Tony seguirá esforzándose para más adelante iniciar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Tony is a very responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead. For many years he has worked as an employee in a large company in his native city, Irazola. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and go out and spend time with his family. He is a very friendly and hard working person. He is always concerned with providing the best for his family.

Tony is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have provided, he will be able to make improvements to his house such as reinforcing the walls and painting the facade. Thus, his parents and brothers will feel more comfortable and secure and Tony will keep working hard to start his own business in the future.

loans.use: to pain the facade and reinforce the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est mariée et a 51 ans. Elle demeure dans le quartier Avénou. Depuis 7ans, elle exerce le commerce des chaussures. Elle se ravitaille au grand marché et sillonne pour revendre  à la criée les différents marchés locaux et hebdomadaires.
Yawa sollicite ce micro crédit pour acheter une  douzaine de chaussure pour femme et une demi-douzaine de tapettes.
Les profits lui permettront d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de participer aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Yawa is married and is 51 years old. She lives in the district of Avénou. She has been selling shoes for 7 years. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market and travels to the different local weekly markets to resell her wares by auction. Yawa is requesting this micro-loan in order to buy a dozen shoes for women and half a dozen fly swatters. The profits she makes will increase her working capital and enable her to contribute to her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a dozen shoes for women and half a dozen fly swatters.

loans.name: Rita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 10 años Rita de 30 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la crianza de vacas, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 3 hijos por quienes lucha cada día ellos estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la crianza de vacas en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de un lote de terreno para tener más espacios en la crianza de más animales para que a ella le genere más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de vacas y la compra de un molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
One of the typical businesses in Sololá is raising animals of all kinds. For ten years, Rita, 30, who lives in her community, has been dedicated to raising cows, a business that generates a satisfactory profit for her family and improves the living conditions of her children. She has three children for whom she works hard every day. They study in school which is near to their community.

The work that she performs is raising cattle in the community where she lives. To her, she makes good earnings because she does not have competition in this business and it helps her improve her living conditions and that of her family.

She has made a loan request to buy a plot of land to have more space for raising more animals so she can earn more money to be able to improve her family's living conditions and to support her community's development in the future.

Her goals are to earn more income to support her family and to keep raising cattle and to buy a maize mill.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his business in order to improve his income and pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est mariée et a 52 ans. Elle vend la bouillie et les beignets à domicile depuis 02ans. Elle s’occupe seule de son activité tous les jours qui lui prend près de 4h de temps.
Afin de réduire les coûts de transport et directement auprès du grossiste, Adjo sollicite un crédit pour acquérir 36 bols de maïs et 01 sac de farine de blé.
texts.en: Adjo is married and is 52 years old. She has been selling porridge and doughnuts from her home for 2 years. She is solely responsible for her business and works for about 4 hours a day. In order to reduce her transport costs by buying directly from the wholesalers, Adjo is requesting a loan so that she can buy 36 bowls of maize and 1 bag of wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy 36 bowls of maize and 1 bag of wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell artisanal items.

loans.name: Las Vengadoras Group

texts.es:
Yoana es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos; uno tiene quince años y el otro cuatro años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de artefactos para cocina.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona ‘plan 3000’, un sitio caracterizado por el crecimiento constante del comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido húmedo con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Yoana es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español (al centro, usa blusa azul, cartera celeste, pantalón jean), su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al pintado de interiores y sus dos hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. La necesidad de expandir y ampliar su negocio la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de refrescos, tienda de barrio, venta de blusas, venta de ropa de bebé, venta de papas fritas y venta de ropa deportiva, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas.
Su negocio es la venta de artefactos de uso doméstico, como; ollas, sartenes, planchas, cocinillas, jarras eléctricas, etc., de manera ambulante. Su trabajo lo realiza de martes a domingo en mercados y diferentes ferias, empujando un carrito cargado de productos y un amplificador de sonido que repite las ofertas y productos ofrecidos, su forma ingeniosa de vender hace que su negocio sea próspero y rentable. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es tener una tienda fija para ya no seguir ambulando, y desea ampliar su oferta realizando la venta de materiales de temporada como; juguetes, disfraces, toallas, etc. para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Yoana solicita un préstamo para ampliar su oferta con productos de temporada y aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en: Yoana is 34 years old. She lives with her domestic partner. She has two children: a fifteen year old one and a four year old one. Her business is selling kitchen items. She is enterprising, constant, independent, responsible and hard working. She sells as a street vendor in the area of ‘plan 3000’, a place known for the constant growth in commerce in all areas, of warm humid climate with an approximate temperature of 30 degrees Celcius during the whole year. Yoana is of dark skin, medium height, long black hair, stocky. Her native language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish (in the middle, blue blouse, light blue purse, jeans). She lives with her partner who works painting interiors, and with her two children. The oldest one goes to school, and she takes care of the young one. Because of the need to expand and broaden her business, she formed a group of people with businesses such as: a stand to sell food, sale of drinks, neighborhood store, sale of blouses, sale of baby clothing, sale of french fries and sale of sport clothing, and applied with them for a loan to fulfill their goals. Her business is selling items of domestic use such as: pots, frying pans, irons, small stoves, electric jugs, etc. as a street vendor. She works from Tuesday to Sunday at markets and different fairs, pushing her little cart filled with products and with a sound amplifier to repeat the offers and the offered products. Her ingenious way of selling makes her business successful and profitable. This is her second loan cycle with the institution. She has been doing this job for three years. Her dream is to have a set store so she does not have to move around, and she would like to broaden her offerings by selling seasonal items such as: toys, costumes, towels, etc. to take advantage of end of year sales. This is why Yoana is requesting a loan in order to broaden her offers with seasonal items and take advantage of end of year sales.

loans.use: to broaden her offer with seasonal products and take advantage of end of year sales.

loans.name: Roosevelt

texts.en:
Roosevelt is a very dedicated son who wants to become successful in the future. He studies Maritime in a university. His parents are both busy with their business. He has five siblings living with his family. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying the school tuition fee for the first semester.

In the future, he hopes to find a better job according to his desire.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 33 years old and married with three children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Thelma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is married and a 46-year-old father of an only child. 

He owns and operates an agriculture business, growing coconuts to resell. Edwin has been engaged in his business for many years and he earns well from these activities.  

His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to buy a vehicle for their transportation, which will be a part of the improvement of his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tam, born in 1969, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined in the saving and credit program in January 1999. Her family consists of 4 members: Mrs. Tam, her husband and her two sons. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two sons are both obedient and good at studying. Her eldest son is studying at University and her youngest son is studying at high school in Mai Son district. 

Her family’s main income is from growing coffee, and each coffee harvest can bring her VND 60-70 million of income. However, the income is just enough for covering living costs and leaves an insufficient amount. She wants to have money to invest in her children’s education and pay her children’s tuition. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes that the loan will help her family with good conditions for investment in her children’s education, and thereby her children will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education and pay her children’s tuition

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 57 years old, married, and a resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through raising pigs.

She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase bags of feed for her growing pigs. She deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC. 

In the future, she hopes to own a meat shop to gain more profit for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed for her growing pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
From Lao Proper, Plaridel, Marilou earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. 

Marilou hopes to live comfortably with her children as they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José no se deja por vencido por los obstáculos de la vida porque el quiere emprender otro tipo de negocio abriendo nuevos campos en la vida el es de 58 años de edad casado que quiere tomar las condiciones de vida como un reto para poder superar y llegar a ser alguien importante en todos los aspectos de su vida laboral y dejar como herencia a sus hijos el trabajo que en un futuro les enseñara.

Cuando no tenía acceso a un crédito las condiciones de vida de el no eran las adecuadas el comenta y agrádese a personas que lo han ayudado a realizar su préstamo pues ahora el ya cuanta con agua potable en su casa para el uso de su familia.

La inversión que el le dará al nuevo préstamo es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotaría para brindarle un servicio a su comunidad ayudándolos en sus consumos diarios. El día con día se esfuerza para tener un ingreso económico y obtener ganancias que tanto les hace falta para mejorar las condiciones de vida.

Las metas futuras de José es la construcción de una casa para sus hijos y familia que tanto les hace falta ya que las condiciones que ahora viven no son favorables ni adecuadas para poder vivir.
texts.en:
Life difficulties won't make José give up. He wants to start up another kind of business to break new ground in his life.

José is 58 years old and he is married. He wants to see his living conditions as a challenge to be overcome, he wants to become someone important in every aspect of his working life, and he wants to pass on to his children the job he will one day teach them.

He says that when he didn't have access to credit, his living conditions were inadequate, and he thanks the people who helped him get his previous loan. Now he has drinking water at home for his family.

He will use the new loan to buy supplies to start up a grocery store, so that he can be of service to the community helping people with their everyday purchases. He struggles everyday to have a regular income and to make much needed profits to improve his family's way of life.

José's future goal is to build a house for his children and family, something they really need given the harshness of the conditions they live in.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Liza has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic goods like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve is 17 years old and is the first of two children in the family. His Mother Marivel supports the family through her business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Steve is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Hospitality Management and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Steve is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

Steve plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Moniroth

texts.en:
Moniroth is a 21-year-old soldier, and he is also a freshman at a university in a city. His major is law. Being a soldier, he can earn approximately $2.83 per day. 

Because of a shortage of finances to pay his tuition fee, Moniroth would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to finish the foundation year successfully. 

In the future, he wants to get another job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is very dedicated to his study and wants to become successful in the future. He is studying to be a seafarer in a university. His parents are earning income from their own farm. He has six siblings living with his family. 

He borrowed this loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. 

In the future, he wants to find a job that enables him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Dzharknay

texts.ru: Джаркнай 60 лет, не замужем, есть сын. Джаркнай на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес с 2008 года. Благодаря упорному труду Джаркнай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 лошади и 3 бычка. Также она арендует 2,0 Га земли, где выращивает малину и клубнику для реализации. Бизнес Джаркнай в месяц приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки бычков. Доходы от кредита Джаркнай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dzharknay is 60 years old, not married, and has a son. She is retired and earns extra income for her family through raising livestock and planting crops, which she began in 2008. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two horses and three young bulls. She also leases a 2.0 hectare plot of land where she grows raspberries and strawberries to sell. Her business brings in about 15,000 som (KGS) each month. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount and buy young bulls. She is planning to invest in additional livestock in the future.

loans.use: to buy more young bulls to fatten and sell

loans.name: Saoeun

texts.en:
Saoeun, 51 years old, lives in a small community of Battambang Province. He has eight children in total; one is married, and seven are single. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a rice farming business on farmland that is located near his house. He has been involved with this business since 2004. He is able to earn a daily income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.

Saoeun wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV, and radio. 

He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Guldoykan

texts.ru: Гулдойкан 56 лет, замужем. У них с мужем трое детей. Гулдойкан в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1991 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулдойкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и одна лошадь, также 5,0 Га обрабатываемой земли, где Гулдойкан выращивает клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулдойкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 18 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота и для улучшения материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Guldoykan is 56 and married. She and her husband have three children. She has been raising livestock and planting crops to earn income for her family since 1991. Thanks to her hard work she currently has two cows, ten sheep and a horse, along with a 5.0 hectare plot of land where she grows clover to sell. Her monthly income from the farm is about 15,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Guldoykan applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 18 sheep. She plans to invest her profits in additional livestock and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 18 sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 57 years old and married with two children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chroeurn

texts.en:
Chroeurn is 24 years old and an engineering student at an institute. He also works as a construction site controller. He is from the Takeo province of Cambodia. He has worked in a city since 2013, earning $7 daily. 

Now he would like to request a loan to pay his second-year tuition fee. With this loan, he will be able to finish the second year successfully. After graduation, being a good engineer with a reasonable salary is Chroeurn’s dream. He also wants to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his second-year tuition fee

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is from Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. 

He is earning a living in his retailing business. To generate more income, Renato decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales. 

Renato smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has been operating her retail store for over seven years and was able to sustain the business. She supported her family and bought some home improvements for a comfortable living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. 

She is now aiming for an increase in sales, and with this, she took a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her inventory capital. She is hoping to cater to the needs of her customers and increase her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her inventory capital.

loans.name: Lhizel

texts.en:
Lhizel  is 36 years old, married with two children, and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur  with her family. She has a retail store that sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income; her husband works as a driver. 

Lhizel  has had the business for 7 years and  works every day in order to provide income for the family and to help improve  their living situation.

Lhizel requested this  loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains to sell in her store.  This will  increase her sales. She plans to expand her business to provide a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta has farmed for many years and she earns a good income. She used a previous loan to buy fertilizer because  to grow more and  financially prepare for the next  season. 

She had  successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan for to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for the next expansion. She is happy to say that she is prepared for a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi for his work.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and  earns additional income  selling ready-to-wear clothing and bananas. Joan is borrowing 35,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Joan has sustained her business  through  6 previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. Erlinda is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has sustained her business through her 20 previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 51 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Carina works very hard to provide for them.

Carina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carina has been in this business for years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Carina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes Evelin

texts.es:
Lourdes de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado ya que no pudo seguir por la situación económica de la familia. Su esposo es empleado en un restaurante  desde hace 8 años mientras que Lourdes se dedica al comercio, elabora antojitos típicos (yuca frita, pastelitos, tamales, pan de torta, enchiladas) los cuales sale a vender de manera ambulante en el caserío y sus alrededores, también cría animales para la venta (cerdos y gallinas). Anteriormente trabajo en una tiende aproximadamente 5 años, después de eso se casó y así como inicia los negocios antes mencionados.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz para los gastos del hogar y para elaborar los antojitos,  comprara cerdos y le ampliara un poco el techo a la casa, pues en ocasiones cuando llueve se le mete el agua a la casa.

 Sus sueños a futuro son  intentar con otro tipo de negocio o conseguir un empleo además formal y ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and studied up to the eighth grade. She was not able to continue because of her family’s economic situation. 

Her husband has been employed in a restaurant for eight years while Lourdes has been earning a living in sales: she makes typical snacks (fried yucca, pies, tamales, bread, enchiladas) which she sells as a street vender in and around the village. She also raises animals (pigs and chickens) to sell. Earlier, she worked in a shop for about five years and then married and began the businesses just mentioned.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy corn, household expenses and to make snacks, buy pigs and to extend the roof of her house a little, since every now and then water gets into the house when it rains.

loans.use: to buy corn to to meet household expenses, prepare snacks for sale, buy pigs and to add on to the roof of her house

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina es una mujer casada, tiene un hijo pero su situacion economica no es buena, por eso vive con sus padres en El Alto en una modesta casa de adobe Regina se gana la vida con la fabricacion de alfombras y necesita un prestamo para comprar lana al por mayor para fabricar alfombras El marido de Regina es albañil pero lo que gana no alcanza para ayudarla pues la pareja tiene gastos familiares pero Regina goza de buena salud y tiene ganas de superarse
texts.en:
Regina is married and she has a child, but her financial situation is not good. That is why she lives with her parents in a humble adobe [mudbrick] house in El Alto.

She makes a living weaving rugs and she needs a loan to buy wholesale wool for her work.

Regina's husband is a construction worker but what he earns is not enough to help her since the couple has family expenses. Regina is in good health and she wants to improve herself.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool to make rugs.

loans.name: Mayolita

texts.en:
Mayolita is 43 years old and from Union Kalinga Luna, Isabela. She is widowed and left with three children. One is Kae Ann, who is taking up a BS in Business Administration major in Financial Management. She believes that finishing her studies is what will give her great opportunities in the near future. She also thinks that this course will be useful since her family’s business is “buy and sell” (retail). 

They sometimes experience shortage of money for books and other school stuff, but it doesn’t hinder her in pursuing her dreams. To help send Kae Ann to college, Mayolita wants to avail herself of a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) education loan from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is married with five children and operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, he also works on their farm to earn extra income. His previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully. 

To increase sales, he took a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeds to sell in addition to his grocery goods. He hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeds to sell in addition to grocery goods.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 52 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Florencia works very hard to provide for them.

Florencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Florencia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Liti

texts.en:
Liti is 38 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school.

Liti works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liti has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Liti aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet, washstand, tiles and tubes to connect to the system.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old widower from Carles, Iloilo. He has four children to support through his fishing business. It is not easy for him to look after his family alone while doing fishing, but he perseveres and works hard so he can provide for his children's basic needs. 

He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon and fishing weights that are necessary for his fishing activity.

John hopes to continue to expand his business so he can send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, rope, nylon and fishing weights

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge owns and operates an agriculture business, growing palay (rice) for sale. Jorge has been engaged in his business for many years, and he earns well from these activities. 

His farm is still doing well and yet, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his farm and to buy a vehicle to use for the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sairakul

texts.ru: Сайракул 57 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сайракул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году с 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сайракул, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 17 овец и 2 лошади. Также на участке 2,60 Га она выращивает ячмень и сено, заготавливая их на зиму в качестве корма для скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайракул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Sairakul is 57, married, and has four children. She earns the main income for her family raising livestock and planting crops, a business she started in 2009 with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work she currently has three cows, two horses, and 17 sheep. She also has a 2.6 hectare plot of land where she plants barley and hay to use as feed for livestock. In order to develop her business, Sairakul applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep to fatten and resell. She plans to use the profits to continue to expand her business because she wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo, ella y su familia viven en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus suegros, la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado Arminda se dedica al trenzado de mantas y quiere comprar cinta para sus trabajos de trenzado con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida Arminda por el momento es la unica persona que pone dinero en el hogar (su pareja esta desempleado) pero goza de buena salud y su negocio es estable, solamente necesita una colaboracion para hacer crecer su negocio
texts.en:
Arminda is in a common-law marriage and she has a child. She and her family live in El Alto, in a house of brick and cement that belongs to her parents-in-law. The house has electricity, water, and a sewer system.

Arminda works making braided blankets and she wants to buy ribbon for her work, with the goal of improving the quality of her life. 

At the moment, Arminda is the only person contributing money to the household (her partner is unemployed). She is in good health and her business is stable, she only needs some assistance to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy ribbon for her braiding work.

loans.name: Ma. Nilfa

texts.en:
Ma. Nilfa works hard to support five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She wants the lamp to have backup light in case of emergency.

Ma. Nilfa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 58 years old, widowed and blessed with five children. All her children have settled for marriage. Leonida has sold rice and hog feed for 8 years. She also has a half hectare of rice field. 

Leonida would like to keep her rice retailing business profitable so she is seeking a loan of 15,000 PHP which allows her to purchase four sacks of rice and three sacks of hog feed to sell. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan in order to supply all her customers and obtain greater income all the time.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of rice and three sacks of hog feed to sell

loans.name: Dinnah

texts.en:
Dinnah is 45 years old and married with six children.

Dinnah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, sugar, beers, candies, noodles, etc. to sell. Dinnah has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and food vending.

Dinnah aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, sugar, beers, candies, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Michelle works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring.  

Michelle is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Veronica

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de platillos típicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años y que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar apoyada en este negocio. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindarle a sus hijos un lugar seguro donde vivir. María desea elaborar y vender tortillas, ya que ha visto que la demanda de este producto es muy grande por lo que ha decidido comprar una plancha para tortillas, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una plancha para tortillas y maíz para iniciar su negocio de venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling a variety of traditional food that she prepares. She has done this work for the past eight years and it has allowed her to support the household economy.

She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, 15 and 6 years old. She feels very happy to be able to provide a safe home for her children.

Maria wants to prepare and sell tortillas. She has seen that there is great demand for this product, which is why she has decided to buy a tortilla griddle. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a tortilla griddle as well as corn to start her business of tortilla sales.

loans.use: to invest in a tortilla griddle and corn.

loans.name: Christegen

texts.en:
Christegen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers for her general store business. Christegen has been in this business for 8 years. Christegen earns additional income from rice retailing.

Christegen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 38 years old and single. He is a resident of Southern Looc, Plaridel, Philippines. Rolando has rented a space in the fish market where he displays his fish to sell. He has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling him to support the health needs of his father. Since he wants to generate more income, Rolando joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. He has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. He is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, he can become a successful vendor someday and eventually a fish stockholder in the public market at nearby towns.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales, des condiments et la fabrication de vin.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur 4éme prêts. ROGINE, 1ère  femme assise de la droite vers la gauche,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil et du bois de chauffage pour fabriquer le vin traditionnel. Elle s’approvisionne sur  place avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sinignessigui group are on average 43 years old with four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tominian/Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali Republic).
These women met through family ties and commercialise various products, cereals, condiments and wine making.
Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sinignessigui group are on their fourth loan. Rogine, the first woman sitting on the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy five sacks of millet and some firewood for the fabrication of traditional wine. She buys her supplies from farmers. She sells her goods to a mixed clientele for cash and often for credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 FCFA which she will use to pay for health care, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making wine.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier SANTORO I SAN /SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des fruits et légumes, de produits divers, des céréales et des condiments. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI  sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. , HAWA  1ère  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des dix paniers de bananes, deux sacs d’oranges. Elle s’approvisionne à San et souvent à Bla. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group are on average 29 years old with three children. They all live in extended traditional families in the Santoro I San/Segou district (fourth administrative region of Mali Republic).
These women met through family ties and sell fruit and vegetables, various products, cereals, and condiments. This is their first loan for the women of the Benkadi solidarity group. Hawa is the first woman sitting on the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy ten baskets of bananas and two sacks of oranges. She buys her supplies in San and often in Bla.
She sells her goods to a mixed clientele for cash and often for credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18.000 FCFA which she will use to pay for health care, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in the business.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena es una mujer emprendedora que cuenta con 34 años de vida de los cuales 4 los ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, en donde vende productos como: maíz, frijol, azúcar, saches de champú, huevos, leche, pan dulce, café, etc. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 11 años al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Morena desea que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias, y es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una refrigeradora y productos para su negocio, ya que desea ampliar su negocio vendiendo productos como: bebidas frías, queso fresco, crema, requesón, paletas, gelatinas, etc.
texts.en:
Morena is an entrepreneurial woman, she is 34 years old and she has dedicated four years of her life to her retail business at her home where she sells products such as: corn, beans, sugar, shampoo sachets, eggs, milk, sweet bread, coffee, etc. She has lived in her own house for 11 years, alongside her husband and her two children; a 2 year old girl and a 6 year old boy. 

Morena hopes that her business will provide her with higher earnings and that is why she has decided to request a loan with FUSAI to invest in a refrigerator and products for her business; all of this in order to diversify her business by selling items such as: cold drinks, farmers cheese, cream, ricotta, lollipops, jellow, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, cold drinks, farmers cheese, cream, ricotta, lollipops, jellow, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Yanina

texts.es: Veronica es una joven estudiante de una carrera tecnica en sistemas , esta joven emprendedora tiene como sueño poder establecer su propia empresa en un futuro , su motivacion principal es su familia ya que siempre ha confiando en ella y le brindan su apoyo dentro de sus posibilidades economicas ,ella desea adquirir unos muebles para poder implementar su habitacion para una mayor comodidad y crecimiento personal , Veronica esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su colaboracion ella podra adquirir los muebles y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y asi continuar con sus proyectos y metas.
texts.en:
Veronica is a student doing a technical degree in systems. She is an enterprising young person, and her dream is to be able to start her own company in the future. Her biggest motivation is her family, as they have always trusted in her and give her all the support they can within their financial limitations.

Veronica wishes to buy some furniture to set up her bedroom, so that she will be more comfortable and to facilitate her personal growth. She is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva, as thanks to their help she will be able to obtain her furniture and with it a better quality of life, and so carry on giving her best to her projects and goals.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara cuenta con 54 años de vida y desde muy joven aprendió ha ganarse la vida de diferentes maneras, pero hace 10 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina y para prepararlos se despierta desde muy temprano a preparar la masa, la gallina, las hojas de huerta, etc. Para preparar los tamales, luego recorre las calles de su cantón y los alrededores ofreciendo sus tamales, los cuales ya esperan sus clientes, ya que por su precio accesible y el rico sabor tiene una excelente demanda. Sara se esfuerza mucho en la preparación de sus productos sobre todo porque no cuenta con una cocina a gas, por lo que debe prepararlos con leña lo que le hace más difícil su trabajo, es por ello que Sara ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una cocina a gas, maíz, gallinas y especies para preparar sus productos y que esto no sea tan difícil como hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Sara is 54 years old and since a young age she learned to earn a living in different ways. Ten years ago she began preparing and selling chicken tamales and in order to do this, she wakes up really early to prepare the dough, the chicken, the garden leaves, etc. for the tamales. She then goes around her community, offering her tamales, and which her clients already demand since the price is affordable and the tamales are flavorful. 

Sara works hard preparing her products, especially since she does not have a gas stove; because of this she has to prepare them with wood and this makes her job more challenging. This is why Sara is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a gas stove, corn, chickens and livestock to prepare her products and so that it will not be as challenging as it is today.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove, corn, hens and other livestock.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Elvira has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Depuis 5 ans, elle commercialise le charbon et le soja. Elle transforme également le soja en brochettes qu’elle vend à la criée et à domicile.
Elle suit avec attention les formations de l’équipe Assilassimé. Pour éviter les ruptures de stock, Adzo sollicite ce crédit par l’acquisition de 20 bols de soja.
texts.en:
Adzo is married and the mother of three. For five years she has been selling charcoal and soy beans.  She also prepares soy brochettes she sells as a street vendor and out of her home.

She is very engaged in the training program provided for the Assilassimé group. In order to avoid running out of stock, Adzo is seeking this loan to buy 20 bowls of soy beans.

loans.use: to buy 20 bowls of soy beans.

loans.name: Alba Yanira

texts.es: Alba de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida cultivando la tierra, y de esta manera obtiene los vegetales y hortalizas que luego comercializa para vivir, además buscando tener mejores ingresos instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo desde hace 30 años por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder darle un lugar seguro donde vivir a su familia. Alba desea seguir mejorando su producción, y para ello desea adquirir abono para que sus cultivos produzcan más y mejores productos, también desea realizar una inversión en su tienda de productos básicos para ofrecer mayor surtido a sus clientes, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI Para invertir en: abono, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, champú, etc. Para sus cultivos y para surtir de mayor cantidad de productos su tienda.
texts.en:
Alba is 41 years old, she is a hard-working woman and she earns a living in agriculture. She obtains her vegetables this way which she then sells in order to survive. Additionally, in order to obtain better revenue, she set up a small essentials store in her home. She has lived in her own house alongside her husband and her child for over 30 years; she is happy to provide safe living conditions for her family. 

Alba wishes to continue improving her output and in order to do this she wishes to acquire fertilizer so that her crops will produce higher and better yields. She also wishes to make an investment in her essentials store to provide a greater variety to her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: fertilizer, rice, beans, sugar, shampoo, etc; for her crops and to increase the supply of goods in her store.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice, beans, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase: shoe-making machine, leather, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a mother from Mayorga, Leyte. She is married and has an 18-year-old child. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods, including cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk, eggs, soap and beverages. She has been  operating the variety store for five years now. She also engages in rice farming as another source of income. She is in need of financial assistance to continue her livelihood. 

Bonifacia has requested a loan  of 10,000 PHP to  purchase additional stock for the store like toiletries, soft drinks and other beverages. 

Bonifacia  hopes to expand her business to improve her livelihood and finance the college education of her child for a better future.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for her store like toiletries, soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia de 26 años de edad es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día para poder sacar adelante a su familia, por medio de su negocio de venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años en su vivienda. Ella es soltera y apoya a su hermana con la que vive desde hace 22 años en vivienda propia, con la educación de su sobrino y los gastos del hogar. Yesenia ha encontrado en su negocio la manera de ganarse la vida, y es por ello que desea comprar una plancha para tortillas ya que actualmente elabora sus productos con leña lo que le dificulta su trabajo y le daña por el humo, es por ello que Yesenia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una plancha para tortillas, maíz y cal para preparar las tortillas que vende en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 26 years old; she is a woman who works hard every day to help her family move forward; she does this through her tortilla retail business, a business that she has performed for over 5 years in her home. She is single and she supports her sister, who she has lived with for 22 years in her own home; she also supports her nephew and home expenses. 

Through this business Yesenia has found a way to earn a living and that is why she wishes to purchase a griddle to heat tortillas; she currently does this with wood but it is challenging and has adverse effects because of the smoke. Yesenia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: a griddle to heat tortillas, corn and lime to prepare the tortillas that she sells in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a griddle to heat tortillas, corn, and lime to prepare the tortillas that she sells in her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel cuenta con 54 años de vida de los cuales 40 los ha invertido en su trabajo como albañil independiente por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de personas que solicitan sus servicios y le recomiendan. Él habita al lado de su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años, por lo que se siente feliz de saber que como familia tiene un lugar seguro donde vivir. Miguel desea encementar el piso del corredor y construir una pila con lavadero en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila con lavadero y encementar el piso del corredor.
texts.en: Miguel is 54 years old and has worked for 40 years as an independent builder. Because of this many people request his services and recommend him to others. He has lived with his life partner and his 7 year old son in his own home for over 3 years. He is happy to know that his family has a safe place to live in. Miguel wishes to coat the hallway floor of his home with cement and to build a laundry room with a sink, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a laundry room with a sink and to coat the hallway floor with cement.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a laundry room with a sink and to coat the hallway floor with cement.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 38 years old and from Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is married and blessed with three children. Her daughter Rachele is taking up a BS in accountancy at Aldersgate College. The family's income comes from Arlyn's husband, who works as a carpenter, but his earnings are not enough to send Rachele to college. That’s why Arlyn wants a PHP 50,000 education loan from KIVA lenders. The family is hopeful for this loan to be approved for this will be a big help to them.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income. Fishing is a lucrative business in his area. Rodney is standing in front of crab cages, or baskets, which are specifically designed for catching crabs.
 
Rodney is asking for a loan for the expansion of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy materials for the repair of his fishing boat, such as plywood, nails and bamboo. This loan will enable him to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

He hopes to make his business sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of his fishing boat, such as plywood, nails and bamboo

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es soltero, no tiene hijos pero tiene que apoyar a sus abuelos con quienes vive en El Alto en unca casa de ladrillo y cemento Oscar es costurero y quiere un prestamo para la compra de utensilios de costura y materiales Oscar tiene una gran responsabilidad que cubrir debido a que sus abuelos tienen una pequeña tienda de comestibles pero este negocio no marcha bien y ademas ellos son personas con delicada salud y eso los desmotiva a seguir atendiendo un negocio cansador, pero Oscar esta en buenas condiciones y su negocio de costura tiene buenas posibilidades, solamente necesita una colaboracion para seguir adelante. La foto de Oscar fue tomada en la tienda de los abuelos
texts.en: Oscar is single, has no children but he supports his grandparents, who he lives with, in a brick and cement house in El Alto. Oscar is a tailor and he is requesting a loan to purchase sewing utensils and supplies. Oscar has a great responsibility to attend to since his grandparents’ small grocery store is not doing well and they suffer from fragile health; this has discouraged them from working in such an exhausting business. Oscar is in good health and his sewing business shows promise, all he needs is support to stride ahead. Oscar’s photo was taken at his grandparents’ store.

loans.use: to purchase sewing utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store (variety store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-scale borrower like her. 

Regina has been able to turn the tide in her favor. She is making good sales these days, and now she wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, Regina requested a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, Regina hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Margie works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Margie is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, needles and the like for her business.

Margie has sustained her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, needles and the like for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
Jose Victor tiene 40 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y dos menores hijos, tienen casa propia de material rustico dos pisos, José Victor y su cónyuge son nacidos en caserío Santa Rosa; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío Santa Rosa del Distrito de Santo Tomas; vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio y está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jose Victor es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad catimor, plantación esta en primer año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 1 has donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío Santa Rosa, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente Jose Victor se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo de productos de pan llevar, todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Santa Rosa, estas actividades realiza en otra parcela también ubicada en el caserío Santa Rosa. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurá mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Victor is 40 years old and has a stable home with his wife and two younger children. They have their own two-floor house made of crude materials. The home has water services. Jose Victor and his wife are from the small village of Santa Rosa. He lives in harmony with his family and in communion with the members of his small village. He lives in the rural part of Santa Rosa, located in the Santo Tomás District, in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru. His community is basically devoted to agriculture, cattle-raising and business.

The work that Jose Victor does is in coffee cultivation. At present he has one hectare of the Catimor variety. This is the field's first year of production and in 2015 it will be in its second year of production. He has his own agricultural land, 1 hectare where the coffee plot is located. He has been doing this work for three years in Santa Rosa. He has experience in coffee cultivation. Additionally, Jose Victor also does work raising beef cattle and growing basic agricultural food products. He does all of this on his own land in the small village of Santa Rosa. He does this work on another plot, also located in Santa Rosa. The loan will be used for maintenance on his hectare of coffee. This will assure a larger and better production for the 2015 season and as a result he will earn a higher income and be able to improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his hectare of coffee and assure a larger and better production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Pelegrina

texts.en:
In 2012, Pelegrina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Pelegrina tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Pelegrina is borrowing another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Pelegrina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo, dedicados al cultivo de café, en el centro poblado de Huacapampa, la casa y terreno de Leonardo se encuentra en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Leonardo se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 15 años, en el Centro poblado de Huacapampa. El destino del crédito es para comprar de abonos e invertir en las labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Con la compra de abonos podrá incrementar sus rendimientos, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Leonardo is 63 years old and lives with his spouse and his son. He works growing coffee in the community of Huacapampa. His house and land are located in the Canaris district, in the province of Ferrenafe, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. His community works for the most part in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Leonardo has been growing coffee for 15 years in Huacapampa. His loan will be used to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to maintain his coffee crop. By buying fertilizer he can increase his yield, which will allow him in the short term to improve his income and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic products such as cups, bowls, buckets, chairs and tables to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to coat his floor with cement and to build half-way walls in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Edwin Agurio

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente trabaja como albañil en su ciudad natal, Lima. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder sacar adelante a su familia, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana sale a realizar sus labores y regresa muy tarde a su casa porque le gusta brindar excelentes servicios y hacer un buen trabajo.
Edwin quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para poder hacer el techado de su casa, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad porque con ello habrá mayor seguridad y comodidad entre sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Edwin is a very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead. He is now working as a bricklayer in his home town of Lima. He has worked since he was very young to support his family. He goes to work very early in the morning and comes home very late at night, because he likes to provide excellent service and do a good job. Because Edwin would like to provide a better quality of life for his family, he plans to use the loan to build a roof for his house. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity, because thanks to them his loved ones will have better security and comfort.

loans.use: to build a roof for his house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 49 years old. She is known in the Lopez Jaena area for her fish vending business. 

Rita actively participates in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. She applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Clarafreda

texts.en:
Clarafreda is 51 years old and widowed with two children. Clarafreda is peddling fresh fish varieties in the local community to make a living. She has been doing this for over 6 years already. 

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit  which will be used to purchase fresh fish supplies and  fishing nets to be used for fishing.

Clarafreda hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, she can gain more income and get the chance to build up another fish stall operating in its own place in the mini-market lane.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish supplies and fishing nets to be used for fishing.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 42 years old and resides in Calatunan, Sindangan Zamboangan Del Norte. She is married and blessed with 3 children who arel in college. She joined Paglaum MPC on April 17,  2008 in order to access the programs and services of Paglaum Cooperative. Recently, she's accessing another loan to purchase a freezer for her existing business which is ice vending. In the future, she hopes to save enough to finance the renovation of her house.

loans.use: buy a freezer

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a nipa-making business for thatch roofing in Sindangan and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, Ruby has availed herself of a loan to purchase more bundles of nipa to sell. She hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of nipa to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 45 years old, married and lives in Mamanga Daku, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs of her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC Daylin obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional bags of feeds for her growing pigs. She really hopes & prays that her business, in addition to the income of her husband, would grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep them in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Elva Luz

texts.es: Elva de 39 años de edad es una mujer casada que habita junto a sus 2 hijos de 18 y 9 años de edad y su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace 25 años. Ella se aprendió a ganarse la vida desde muy joven, pero actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos helados, además su esposo que se desempeña como albañil independiente le apoya también con la economía de su hogar. Elva buscando lo mejor para su familia invirtió en la compra del derecho de instalación de energía eléctrica, pero la liquidez no fue suficiente para realizar al instalación interna, y es para ello que Elva solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, tomacorriente, caja térmica, interruptores, etc. Para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elva is 39 years old, married, and lives with her two children ages 18 and 9, and her husband in a home she has owned for 25 years. She learned to earn a living at a young age, she currently sells frozen products and her husband works as an independent builder who supports the family income. 

Elva’s desire to improve her family’s wellbeing made her invest in the purchase of electric energy installation rights. Her liquidity was not enough to perform the internal installation and that is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase: electric wire, outlets, a cool box, switches, etc. to install electric energy in her home.

loans.use: to purchase: electric wire, outlets, a cool box, switches, etc. to install electric energy in her home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel tiene 34 años, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Miguel Ángel se dedica al servicio de copias, tipeos. Hace aproximadamenete más de 5 años. Necesita préstamo para compra de tinta, papel, y mantenimiento de fotocopiadora. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel Angel is 34 years old and lives with his parents in the district of Cayalti. This is a community located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru, where the population works in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Miguel Angel has worked for a bit more than 5 years providing typing and printing services. He needs a loan to buy ink and paper, and to pay for maintenance of a photocopy machine. This will allow him in the short term to increase his income, and therefore to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy ink and paper, and to pay for maintenance of a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 45-year-old married woman from the village of Shalauri. She lives with her husband, son and daughter. The family earns a living with the help of a small agricultural business. Particularly, Leila has a dairy farm and sells milk products locally. She generates an insignificant income that isn't enough to cover even basic needs. So, the family needs some investments to make financial stability and increase their income. 

Leila requested a loan from local financial institutions but without any success, as she was considered a high-risk borrower because of her low income. Her loan application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives a chance to the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

Leila plans to use the loan to purchase stocks of clothing and sell in her community with price mark-ups. Her income will significantly increase with the help of this new business initiative and Leila will increase her bit toward her family's welfare.  She awaits your support and kindness and will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 32-year-old widow from Zugdidi district. She was left alone to take care of her 2 sons, who are school-aged and don't have any income themselves.  

Irma started working as a waitress at the local restaurant and generates 350 GEL monthly. Her son married several month ago and Irma's salary is found to be very small for covering even the basic needs of her expanded family.  This hard-working woman has great motivation to create financial stability for her sons and daughter-in-law and wants to start a parallel private activity. 

Irma has requested a Credo loan to start up a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo.
