The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credits on soft conditions to the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Using the loan Irma will purchase stocks of clothing to sell in her community with increased prices. As a result of this new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of her family will increase by 200%.  Irma will be able to create better living conditions for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is a 43-year-old married woman from the small village of Zeda Etseri. She lives with her 2 daughters, son and husband.  Her husband's income is the only source of existence for this 5 members-family. Ekaterine's husband works as a private worker and generates 200 GEL monthly. As the family can't cover even basic needs with this income only and live under poverty, Ekaterine planned to be involved in her own activity and somehow give help for her family. 

According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Ekaterine has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credits on soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this loan Ekaterine will purchase stocks of various home products to sell in her community with price mark-ups   As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of her family will significantly increase. Ekaterine and her husband will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: buy home products

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso, who is a 44-year-old married woman, lives in the capital of Georgia. She has school-aged daughter and a husband who has a stable job and generates a fixed salary. 

After her secondary education Eliso was unable to find any stable job, so her husband's income is the only source for covering all their daily expenses.  However his salary is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Because of this situation, Eliso decided to start her own business and opened a bakery. She purchased some inventories and start baking herself. Now, she needs financial support to purchase additional tools and materials to continue providing her service. 

Eliso requested a loan and was approved through the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  This start-up program provides informal businesses with credit on soft conditions. With the loan  Eliso plans to renovate her bakery at first and then expand the variety of baked products. She already has her loyal customers and will get a chance to make more profits after receiving the loan. 

Eliso and her family will highly appreciate Kiva Lenders help, as the loan will greatly support to this hardworking woman.

loans.use: renovate her bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: open a block factory

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 41-year-old married woman from the village of Korbouli. She has a husband and two sons. The only source of income for this 4-member family is her son’s job who works as an private artisan and generates 500 GEL monthly.  As this income is hardly enough to meet their basic needs and cover daily expenses, Lia requested financial support to local credit providers.  All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Lia applied for the credit with MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva to permit poor people to start or re-start businesses.  

With this loan Lia will purchase a tractor and rent it on private orders. This will give her family a chance to make additional income and cover some of the  family costs more easily.  Lia and her family members rely on the  good will of Kiva lenders and will be really grateful for the help, as their living condition will significantly increase.  Regards, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy a tractor to rent out

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is a 40-year-old married woman from the village of Badiauri. She lives with her husband and two daughters. The family has income from an  agribusiness. In particular Pikria and her husband work hard and take care of a milk cow and chickens. They sell the produced cheese locally and get a  small income. 

In order to make their business more profitable Pikria wants to expand her agribusiness and purchas6e 3 cows. After growing them, the family will get  the chance to produce more milk products and make more profit. 

Pikria sought credit from local financial institutions but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The start-up program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  Pikria's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 800 GEL.
 
The Start Up credit will be a great support for Pikria's family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards, Kiva Lenders. Pikria awaits your support.

loans.use: buy 3 dairy cows

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 57-year-old married woman from Samtredia district. She lives with her husband, who works as a loader and gets 200 GEL monthly. This is the only source of income for them and it’s clear they find it really hard to earn a living.  

Leila, who has secondary education but was unable to find any stable job, decided to start her own business and requested a loan. She needs financial support to purchase stocks of clothing  and to have money for working capital. Leila has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides business start-up with loans on soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Leila will sell products door-to-door, will have her own costumers and get private orders also. The loan will greatly assist her in improving her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 44-year-old merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She has a retailing business. She sells children's footwear like sandals, slippers, and school shoes. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now. Emelita and her husband have four children. The oldest child is 25 and the youngest is 8. Her husband is a baker in one of the bakery chains in the community.  

Emelita has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy a variety of footwear like school shoes, ladies' sandals, and slippers. This will help Emelita and her family improve her sales and increase her earnings.

Emelita hopes to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood and to finance the schooling of her two children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of footwear like school shoes, ladies' sandals, and slippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tin sheets, wood and nails to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en: Ermetania is married and has six children. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living. For many years, it has been her main source of income. She also has a vegetable garden which provides weekly earnings. Her previous loan, which she used to buy seedlings and fertilizer, has been repaid successfully. To improve her production, she has taken a new loan to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides to have a more productive farm. She wants to expand her farm and to renovate their house for a safe and comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides to have a more productive farm

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Retailing helped Carmelita survive for the family. She retails charcoal and brings a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do was to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. 

Carmelita plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. 

Carmelita smiles at the idea of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es:
María Aurelia tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar por más de 27 años, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza María Aurelia es la venta de abarrotes en general, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona, cuenta con más de 2 años dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en: Maria Aurelia is 50 years old and is a single mother. She has lived in her family home for more than 27 years, and has no more dependent children. She lives in the rural part of the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaen, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. She has running water and electricity. Her community works for the most part in agriculture, livestock and commerce. Maria Aurelia works selling groceries. She has established customers in the area because she has been doing this work for more than 2 years. The purpose of the loan is to invest in supplying her business with new products, so that she can earn more income and improve her quality of life. There is no one better at this job in her area, and she provides better prices.

loans.use: to invest in supplying her business with new products

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is a 23-year-old young woman who lives in the small village of Savane, Georgia. She lives with her parents and works as a server at the local cafe. 

Teona earns 200 GEL monthly and helps her father maintain financial stability. Teona's father also earns 200 GEL each month from his work as an artisan. However, the family still finds it very hard to cover all their daily expenses and require another source of income to help tackle their financial difficulties. 

Teona requested a loan from several local financial institutions to start a dairy farm business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because the creditors did not find the family's income to be sufficient. 

Then Teona requested a loan from Credo and has since been approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. This startup loan program provides startup credit "soft conditions" for the country's rural poor - people who lack access to credit products because their low income classifies them as "high risk borrowers". 

With the credit she's received, Teona will be able to purchase 2 dairy cows and start producing dairy products, which she will use for local trading.

Teona's new business initiative, financed with this Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase her family's income, and Teona's family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 dairy cows so she can start dairy farming.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Héctor de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hijo de 9 años de edad. Él es un padre responsable que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su localidad, es por ello que se siente satisfecho de poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y apoyar a sus padres con la economía de su hogar. Héctor desea remodelar la cocina de su vivienda, ya que actualmente está hecha de bajareque por lo que él desea construirla de cemento, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y lamina para remodelar la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Héctor is 36 years old and lives in his own home, together with his parents and nine-year-old son. He is a responsible father who earns his living as a security guard for a nearby company. He feels happy to be able to help his little boy do well and help his parents with the household costs.

Héctor wishes to remodel the kitchen of their home; the current construction has mud walls, so he would like to rebuild it with cement. He is therefore seeking a loan via FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, reinforcing steel and metal sheeting in order to rebuild the kitchen of his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, reinforcing steel and metal sheeting to rebuild the kitchen of his home.

loans.name: Hilol

texts.en:
Hilol lives with her family in a rural area. She is widowed and has 4 children. 

 Hilol is the only provider for her children and works hard from early morning until late evening to earn a  living. Her business is animal husbandry and she feeds sheep. Hilol has a big cowshed and grows feed in her garden. Her elder sons help her to feed  the 7 sheep. Hilol also feeds 5 cows.

She is going to increase the number of  sheep and requests 12,000 TJS to buy 24 sheep. 

She awaits your kindness and  thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy 24 sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic supplies to fertilize his cocoa plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin building her home with noble materials.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Antonietta works hard to support her family.

She has a direct-selling, personal collection products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear. Antonietta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of personal collection products to sell to her customers through her direct-selling, personal collection products business.

Antonietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal collection products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the food store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, la joven vive  con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y si tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman, whose face has been pixelated because she is 20 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has a stall where she sells fruits and vegetables located in the municipal market. She has many customers due to her products' quality and the good prices. She lives with her life partner and their daughter. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and, so, have more income.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Mariniel

texts.en:
Mariniel is managing her food vending business in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. 

Mariniel has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her food vending business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian earns a living managing her small grocery store. 52 years old and married, she has never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of her family. 

Vivian is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has already taken and successfully repaid several loans. She continues to maintain her membership in good standing without any record of default. PMPC stood by her and helped Vivian start her chosen business. 

Now, Vivian is applying for a loan so she can restock her store and increase inventory with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Vivian continues to seek business ideas and opportunities, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to restock her store and increase her inventory with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Kemverly

texts.en:
Kemverly is single and has operated a retail scrap materials business for 2 years.

Kemverly requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

In the future, Kemverly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and brother-in-law in the Khoni District. Tea's husband is an artisan and earns a small monthly income. Her brother-in-law is an invalid and receives a small monthly pension of 100 GEL from the government, which is for medicine. 

Tea is involved in agricultural activities. She has a cow and a pig and she milks the cow everyday to produce cheese to sell locally. As the income is only seasonal, she decided to start an additional stable business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL. With the received credit, Tea will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then will resell them at a higher price to generate profit.

loans.use: to begin a clothing trade business to generate a stable income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build other rooms in the house and to renovate the older areas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand his home by building a room for his children and renovating the old area.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina sells local rice cakes and a variety of vegetables to her local community. She is 62 years old and is married to a farmer. 

Silvina has been selling her local rice cakes and vegetables for 30 years now. She and her husband both work hard to have a better way of life and get ahead. 

Silvina would like to increase her profits to be able to save for any future emergencies. To achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to purchase additional rice cakes, sugar, cooking oil, coconuts and various vegetables. 

Silvina hopes that, with this loan, she will be able to further improve her food sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice cakes, sugar, cooking oil, coconuts, and a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Ñuruñupe del distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a los cultivos de arroz, frutales y cafeto, comercio de los mismo y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Wilfredo se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con terreno propio en el caserio de Ñuruñupe en donde cuenta con una finca de lima frutera, la cual se encuentra en buen estado, cuenta con mas de 06 años de experiencia en el rubro, además el cliente se dedica al comercio de animales como son ganado vacuno, caprino, porcino, ovino, etc. Cuenta con muy buenas refrencias personales, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de abonos para su finca mencionada. Invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptale para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 43 years old, he lives with his wife and children in the village of Ñuruñupe, in San Felipe district, a community which works in agriculture, specifically growing rice, fruit, and coffee, selling those products and in animal husbandry, located in Jaén province, which belongs to Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Wilfredo works in agriculture and has his own land in the village of Ñuruñupe where he has a lime tree farm, which is in good condition. He has more than 6 years of experience in this field, and in addition he works selling animals such as cattle, goats, pigs, sheep, etc. He has many good personal references. The loan is destined to be invested in his business, purchasing fertilizer for the farm mentioned above. Investing in his business will allow him to have an acceptable utility so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business, purchasing fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 59-year-old married woman with six children; one child attends school.

Lilia has raised pigs for 20 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously  borrowed 5 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure  her family's future.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is 45 years old. She is a widow and lives with her son and daughter-in-law in the small village of Lagodekhi. Zeinab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a greenhouse, where she grows cucumbers and tomatoes to sell at a good price locally. 

Zeinab decided to start a husbandry business alongside her other agricultural activities. She requested a loan and the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase calves in order to raise and expand her husbandry business in future.

loans.use: to purchase calves and start a husbandry business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 36 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorena has had a fish vending business for 21 years and requests 12,000 PHP  through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 51 years old and married with two children. 

Adelaida has grown  corn for 4 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizes and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She lives and works in the north part of Tajikistan. and has a business to   buy and sell children's clothing. She sells a variety of children's clothes in her store at the local market.  Manzura has managed the business alone for 5 years. 

Manzura is a very social woman and is known to  each of her clients. Manzura periodically renews the assortment of  goods and there is a lot of competition  in the local market. She is asking for  6,000 TJS to buy children's clothing for the new winter season. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the  new winter season

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
Felipa es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene seis hijos de 19, 17, 15, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad, y  su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado popular caracterizado por encontrarse en un barrio grande al sur de la ciudad, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Felipa es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada con mandil celeste). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus seis hijos, los cuatro mayores estudian en la escuela y los dos menores se encuentran a su cuidado, toda la familia vive junta en una casa alquilada con dos habitaciones, baño y cocina, tienen agua potable y luz eléctrica. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; carnicería, tienda de videos, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa y venta de fruta, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; el pipián (basado en carne de res ó en pato), el locro carretero (carne deshidrata y yuca), el majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito), el cogote relleno (cuellos de gallina relleno) y el rapi (carne, arroz, urucú). Cada comida es cocinada una vez a la semana, los clientes ya conocen el menú diario. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en cuatro años que lleva con esta actividad. Debido a la humedad y al paso del tiempo su puesto de venta se ha desgastado, por lo que pierde clientela, ella desea realizar una refacción de su puesto de venta para recuperar los clientes perdidos.
Es por esos motivos que Felipa solicita un préstamo para refaccionar su puesto de venta y recuperar a sus clientes perdidos.
texts.en:
Felipa is 38 years old, she lives with her partner and she has six children ages 19, 17, 15, 9, 5 and 3. She sells traditional meals. 
She is a good mother, honest, generous, comprehensive, patient, and a good listener, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in a popular market characterized for being located in a big neighborhood south of the city; the weather is warm, tropical and humid and the temperature is a constant 30 degrees centigrade throughout the whole year. 

Felipa has a dark complexion, she is medium height, she has black long hair and her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish (she is sitting down and has a blue apron). She has lived her life along with her partner who works in construction and her six children; the four older ones study in school and the two youngest ones are under her care. All of her family lives with her in a rented house with two rooms, a bathroom and kitchen, with potable water and electricity. 

Her desire to improve made her create a group of businesspeople; businesspeople working in butchery, a video store, a sandwich shop , chalk artisan, refreshments, library, clothing retail and fruit retail who request a loan to improve their businesses. She sells traditional food in her business, food such as pipian (beef or duck based), street locro (dried beef and yucca), majadito de charque (dried beef, rice and fried plantains), cogote relleno (filled chicken throats) and rapi (beef, rice and urucu). Each meal is prepared once a week and the clients already know what the menu looks like. This is the first set of loans that will be requested from the organization in the four years that she has been involved in this business. Due to humidity and the passing of time, her stall has worn out; she has lost clients because of this and she wishes to upgrade her stall in order to recuperate her lost clients.

 It is because of this that Felipa is requesting a loan to upgrade her stall and recover her lost clients.

loans.use: to remodel her food stall and to recover her lost clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for weather changes to improve wellbeing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Calube, Aloran in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family. Gloria has been able to send all her children to school until they graduated and secured their own jobs. 

Out of the money she has saved, Gloria purchased a 2-hectare plot. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconuts of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. 

However, Gloria is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings. 

Gloria has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
Virgina is a 39-year old married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Virgina has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 44 years old and has four children. Anabelle is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Anabelle is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Anabelle requested a 17,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anabelle has been in pig fattening for 5 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 33-year-old married man with three children.  They live with his family in Taiz city, Yemen.  He is an educated man, employed with a public sector, and earning a small salary. 

The house  lacks many  home appliances and furniture.   Most of them are very old. The family feels  inconvenienced from this condition but they can not afford new appliances or furniture. The family feels ashamed when any visitor or one of the relatives comes to their house. 

Ahmmed wants to provide his family with  furnishings and appliances. Unfortunately, his salary is not enough to do that. As a result, Ahmmed requests a loan from Al- Amal Microfinance Bank for 200,000 YER to purchase the  furniture for his house.

loans.use: to purchase  furniture for his house.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a productive and hard-working woman with five adult children. She generates income for her family through banana and corn farming.

Her loan from PMPC for PHP 14,900 helps her buy more fertilizer. She hopes to double her harvest this coming season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Otilia Isabel

texts.es:
Otila Isabel tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de aves de cerdos, cuyes y cuyes. Vive con su sus niños de 07 y 02 años de edad. Persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Su comunidad está ubicada en distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Otila Isabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de cerdos y cuyes. Inversión en construcción de corrales para criadero de cerdos, pues de esta forma podrá criar en mejores condiciones a sus animales y podrá seguir atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, ampliando su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Otila is 35 years old, single and is known in the field for raising and selling birds, pigs and guinea pigs. She lives with her 7 year old and 2 year old sons. She is a person with good personal and labor references. Her family is very close. She lives in a community dedicated to trade, agriculture and livestock. Her community is located in the Saña district, Chiclayo proving, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. 

Otila Isabel raises and sells pigs and guinea pigs. Investing in the construction of pig-raising pens will allow her to improve the conditions of her animals and she will also be able to attend the unsatisfied demand in the place; increasing her client base, including new clients and expanding additional income for her family. This will allow her, in the short-term, to increase her revenue, increase her earnings and her lifestyle and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of pens to raise pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and married with six children, four attend school. Sonia works very hard to provide for them.

Sonia has  run a general store for 3 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  beverages and canned goods.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  requests a loan of $800.00 USD to improve her business. She sells gasoline and petrol to earn a good income. Slives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline and petrol.  She is happy to do this business. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more gasoline and petrol. Elizabeth has been involved in business activities since 2014 which she started with  $ 300.00 of her own money. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she knew she would be able to improve her management and run a  bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline and petrol.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Jerie Mae is 22 years old and is the  3rd of  4 children in the family. Her mother Marissa, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her retail clothing business.

Jerie Mae is studying to earn a Bachelor of Science degree in elementary education and is currently in her 2nd year of the 4-year program.

Marissa requests 12,000 PHP to pay her daughter's  tuition fees  for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

 Jerie Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed so she could help to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria tiene 33 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños desde hace 6 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, realiza sus ventas durante todo el año, tiene muchos clientes ya establecidos que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la calidad de la ropa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 33 years old, is a single mother and lives in a house she owns with her two daughters. She has made a living by selling clothing for women, men and children for the last six years. She sells in an itinerant fashion around various neighborhoods; she makes sales year-round and already has a lot of established customers who prefer her for her good prices and the quality of her clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy clothing wholesale to be able to continue with her work and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, sand, bricks and re-bar to build a room on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Genieviv

texts.en:
Genieviv is a married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is 29 years old and has no children yet. She engages in an RTW (ready-to-wear) retail business. She sells dresses, pants, shoes, ladies' sandals, shirts, and blankets. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now.  

Genieviv has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy assorted stocks of RTW, like ladies' jeans, pants, t-shirts, blouses, and footwear, like ladies' shoes. These materials are essential tools to improve her sales and attract more customers.  

Genieviv is hoping to expand her business for the welfare of her future children someday.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks of RTW (ready-to-wear), like ladies' jeans, pants, t-shirts, blouses, and footwear.

loans.name: Anabel Rosario

texts.es:
Anabel es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, trabaja en un restaurante de su ciudad natal, Ica. También desde hace algún tiempo viene incursionando en la venta de calzados y ropa. Ella cree que le está yendo bien porque día a día se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus ventas y así poder obtener mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que los prestamistas Kiva confían en Anabel, en esta ocasión piensa utilizar el crédito para seguir comprando mercadería, es decir zapatos por temporada de verano para así poder surtir su negocio. Con esto ella espera seguir creciendo como empresaria para así pueda sacar adelante a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Anabel is an entrepreneurial young woman who wishes to improve in life. She works at a restaurant in her hometown of Ica. She has also been working for some time in the footwear and clothing retail sectors. She believes she is doing well because every day she works hard to increase her sales and in that way obtain greater revenue to support her family. 

It is the second time that Kiva lenders trust Anabel, this time she will use the loan to continue purchasing merchandise; summer season shoes to supply her business. With this she expects to continue growing as a businesswoman and in that way improve the wellbeing of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for the summer season for her business.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 10 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de la casa, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her two children. She has worked growing basic grains for the past 10 years. With her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She wants to make improvements on her house building a room in the location shown in the photo. What she makes is not sufficient to do this. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, re-bar and pay for labor so that her and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement. bricks, sand, re-bar and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en:
Lamia successfully repaid her first loan provided by Kiva lenders to purchase housewares.  She applied for a second Youth loan of 90,000 YER from AMB  to purchase a refrigerator because she does not have one. 

Lamia is very thankful to Kiva lenders for her first loan which helped her to make necessary improvements in her house. Lamia hopes to receive this second loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un molino de nixtamal desde hace 4 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde ella reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For four years she has had a corn mill located in her home. She is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp, because there is no electricity in her community, and she does not earn enough to buy one. The lamp is a charging station with energy from solar panels that works in homes in rural areas where there is no electricity. With this purchase she and her family will benefit, as they will have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. y mejorar el horno que muestra en la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48 years old and he lives with his wife in their own home. He has had a bakery located at the residence for nine years. He has a lot of customers, due to the quality of his bread making. With the money he makes, he has managed to get by with the household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, baking tins, etc and to improve the oven that is shown in the picture, so he can continue working to increase his income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, flavored jellies, baking tins, etc. and to improve the oven.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente los vecinos, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, harina de arroz, aceite, quesillo, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For the last number of years she has worked making and selling pupusas. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has lots of clients, especially the neighbors. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase corn, beans, pork cracklings, rice flour, oil, cheese, etc to be able to make more income.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork cracklings, rice flour, oil, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Vipaji Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a single mother in her mid-30s. She has a son and daughter who are still in school. She has been running a genge duka (groceries) business for three years now. She works from 6am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This loan will be Sakina's first request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to increase her genge duka stock. She dreams of making her business big.

Sakina will share this loan with the Vipaji group. It consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Francisca Meris

texts.es: Francisca de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: sopas, pan dulce, granos básicos, café, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca is 41 years old and she lives in her own home with her family. For many years she has had a small store located in her home. She has many customers, due to the variety of products she sells and because of the good prices. 

With the money she makes, she has managed to pay for some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as: soup, sweet bread, staple grains, coffee, sugar, beverages, candy, etc and this way she will be able to continue with sales and make a larger profit.

loans.use: to buy more soup, sweet bread, staple grains, coffee, sugar, beverages, candy, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida de 39 años de edad es una mujer que todos los días se esfuerza por salir adelante al lado de su compañero de vida y apoyada en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que esperan por sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años a lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar propio donde vivir. Aida anteriormente adquirió un crédito con el cual colocó balcones a las ventanas de su vivienda dándole mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que ahora solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, lámina y polines para colocar ladrillo de piso e instalar techo al corredor de su vivienda. Expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibió en el pasado.
texts.en: Aida is 39 years old and is a woman who works every day to get ahead, together with her spouse. For 5 years she has worked selling beauty products from a catalogue, and has a good number of customers who want her products. She has lived in her own home for 8 years with her spouse and 2 children who are 17 and 14, and is happy to have her own place to live. With a previous loan, Aida put bars on the windows of her house to provide her family with better security. She is now requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, sheet metal, and poles, in order to install flooring and a roof in the corridor of her house. She says that she is very grateful for the support that she has received in the past.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, sheet metal, and poles, in order to install flooring and a roof in the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda en su casa, con lo que gana logra salir adelante, la joven vive con su grupo familiar ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos granos básicos, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, refrescos, detergente,etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y así poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman who has her face pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She owns a store inside her home and she has been able to get ahead with what she earns. The young woman lives with her family.  

She is requesting a new loan to purchase more products: basic grains, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, soft drinks, detergent, etc.  Sales in her business have been very good and this loan will enable her to continue making a better income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, soft drinks, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una peque tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende shampoo, detergentes, jabón, refrescos entre otras cosas, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito ya que quiere surtir su tienda con mas productos como golosinas, sopas, granos básicos, huevos, pan, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred because she is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area has a small store located in her home where she sells shampoo, detergents, soap, and drinks, among other items. The young woman lives in a house she owns with her family. She is asking for a loan because she wants to stock her store with more products like candy, soups, basic grains, eggs, bread, etc. In this way she will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy candy, soups, basic grains, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy cattle shelter, to keep the cows healthy and producing milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy appliances to furnish his home

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de popan alto-cayalti y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Jose Luis se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes en general, desde hace más de 3 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Además se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Solicita préstamo para la compra de andamios y vitrinas para ampliar su negocio. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio, o que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Jose Luis is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and children in their own home, in a small community in the rural area of Popan Alto-Cayalti. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. Jose Luis has worked for 3 years selling groceries from his home. He also works raising and selling animals. He is requesting a loan to buy shelving and display cases, in order to expand his business. In this way he will be able to grow his business, which will enable him in the short term to increase his income and thereby improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy shelving and display cases, in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Ona

texts.en:
Ona is a 21-year-old, single woman who is living with her parents. Ona initiated a pig breeding business in 2012, after she graduated from high school, in order to generate additional income for her family. It took seven to eight months to raise the pig before it got sold. The selling price is around IDR 3,500,000 – 4,500,000 per pig, depending on the weight. At the moment, Ona has two pigs, which she has been raising for almost eight months. They are ready to be sold. The profit will be given to her mother, for a sudden need.

Ona desires to purchase more piglets to raise; therefore, she applied for a loan from TLM, amounting to IDR 3,000,000. By having additional capital from TLM, Ona will be able to get at least three or four piglets.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 18 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres y sus dos hermanos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is blurred because she is eighteen years old and lives in a high risk area, has been selling clothing for the past two years. 

Her business is located at her home in a very busy area, which is why she has a lot of customers. The young woman lives at home with her parents and two brothers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothing in bulk so she can continue with sales and increase profit.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 17 years old, and is the first of the five children in the family. Her mother, Evelyn, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Renalyn is studying toward a bachelor of science in business administration degree. She is currently in the first of this 4-year course.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000. She will use this loan to pay the tuition fees of her daughter, Renalyn, for the second semester of the school year 2014-15. Renalyn plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees, as she pursues a BS in Business Administration

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Z.N. She is married and has three children. Jocelyn has a fish-vending business and owns a fishing boat. She earns approximately PHP 9,000 each month, doing her work.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use this amount to purchase another fishing boat, for her fishing business. She wants to obtain more income with the additional fishing unit. Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase another fishing boat

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Rosalie has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years now. She has borrowed seven times before through NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy feed and vitamins.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store. Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is 52 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Federita has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Federita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pesticides for her cabbages and tomatoes, to have a bigger yield at harvest time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the pipes for sewage and potable water in order to guarantee hygiene in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in:  potatoes, mayonnaise, ketchup, and hard cheese.

loans.name: Paula Rosario

texts.es: Paula de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 10 años, vende de forma ambulante por los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes fijos, Paula está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz para tamales, verduras, pollos,  vegetales, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Paula is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her son. She has worked selling tamales for 10 years, walking through neighbouring towns to sell them, and now has permanent customers. 

Paula asks for this loan to buy corn to make tamales, as well as vegetables, chicken, etc. Thus, she can continue with her work as it is now her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tamales, as well as vegetables, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Chiva

texts.en: Chiva is 24 years old, a fourth-year student at the university and an English literature major. He is from the Takeo province of Cambodia. To cover his study expenses, he has been employed as an administrative staffer in a city since 2011, earning $7 per day. Due to the fact that he is short of finances to pay his tuition fee, Chiva would like to request a loan. This loan will help him graduate successfully. For his dreams, he wants to run an English Center and own a house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una mujer emprendedora que desea inciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa y en un futuro poder comprar una mototaxi para poder generar mas ingresos en su hogar , su mayor motivacion para continuar con sus sueños son sus menores hijas , ella lucha dia a dia para sacarlas adelante y puedan culminar sus estudios universitarios , ya que ella solo pudo concluir la secundaria , elizabeth es una mujer alegre que le gusta bailar optimista  , el cual se encontraria muy agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que si logra obtener el credito podra cumplir sus metas trazadas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is an enterprising woman who hopes to start her own business selling clothes, and in the future be able to buy a motorcycle taxi to be able to generate a higher income for her home. 

Her major motivation to continue pursuing her dreams are her youngest daughters. She fights daily to be able to get them ahead, so that they can finish their university studies, as she could only finish high school. 

Elizabeth is a happy and optimistic woman who likes to dance. She is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because if she obtains her loan she will be able to make her goals reality and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to start her own business.

loans.name: Carla Jennifer

texts.es:
Carla es madre soltera de un pequeña niña de 1 año de edad, por quien trabaja día a día para poder brindarle mejores oportunidades. Actualmente está ocupando el puesto de cajera en un supermercado, ella asume su puesto con mucha responsabilidad y honestidad. También con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir una mototaxi que alquila a un señor de confianza y con esos ingresos está mejorando la calidad de vida de su pequeña. Carla tiene por sueño poder ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional ya que ella no pudo estudiar una carrera porque salió embarazada y tuvo que trabajar.
Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer arreglos a la mototaxi porque ha estado fallando. Con esto ella no tendrá inconvenientes al momento de alquilarlo. Más adelante espera poder innovar con un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Carla is a single mother to a small 1 year old girl for whom she works day to day in order to provide with better opportunities. She currently holds a position as a cashier at a supermarket. She takes on her position very responsibly and honestly. Also, with much effort, she was able to acquire a motorcycle taxi which she rents from a man she trusts and, with this income, is improving the quality of life of her little one.

Carla dreams of seeing her daughter become a great professional since she could not study for a career because she got pregnant and had to work. 

She is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided her she will be able to make repairs to the motorcycle taxi since it has been malfunctioning. With this, she will not have any drawbacks when she rents it. Later on, she hopes to be innovative with a new business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is a married woman with seven children. She is 49 years old and two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liliosa has a salt vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of salt to sell.

Liliosa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of salt to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice has a live-in partner woman with five children. Janice is 26 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Janice has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 55 years old, married, and has three children. One child is in school.

Juanita has been raising pigs in the Philippines for four years. She has borrowed twice before from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 7,000 loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia is borrowing PHP 1,800  through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Letecia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 49 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Juana operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Juana requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items to sell, such as beverages, groceries, etc. In the future, Juana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old now with six children. With five of her children in school, Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, canned goods, etc..

Jane has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, and canned goods

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 61-year-old Palestinian widowed mother of five children who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to her poor financial situation, she opened a grocery shop inside the refugee camp to cover the needs and expenses of her family.
Fatima is the sole earner of her family and is trying hard to satisfy their needs. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make a healthier and better place for her beloved children. She also wants to increase her business merchandise with more requested products to attract more customers. 
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house and increase her business merchandise

loans.name: Juana Mavel

texts.es: Doña Juana de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima para seguir con su trabajo como: chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz, harina de arroz, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Juana is 60 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has worked selling pupusas for 3 years. Her business is located in her house, and she has many customers. 

She asks for a loan to be able to buy more raw materials to continue with her work, such as pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, etc., and thus be able to have higher earnings.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is a thirty-four-year-old single woman from Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including noodles, eggs, cooking oil, powdered milk, and soft drinks. She has been operating the variety store for almost two years.

Due to very limited capital, Jerlyn has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise like biscuits, beverages, toiletries and soft drinks. This will help Jerlyn to bring her business back to its normal operation and hopefully will augment her income.

Jerlyn hopes to improve her family's living condition by expanding her business for a sustainable livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like biscuits, beverages, toiletries and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and metal, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

Emma successfully paid a previous loan and now requests a loan to further build her business. NWTF is listing Emma's profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irish is 22 years old now.

She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell  .

Irish has been in this business for two years. In the future, Irish would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and restaurant. Jenny is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 35-year-old married mother of two children.  She lives with her family in the town of Ormoc, Leyte.  She is engaged in a small poultry business.  Raising chickens in her backyard is her source of income. Her husband is a carpenter.

Rosalie is asking for a loan to buy chickens and animal feed. This will allow her to raise more chickens, which she can sell after several weeks.  Rosalie hopes to improve her business in the future.  She also wants to save money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Khoa

texts.en:
Khoa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.
Khoa is 56 years old and is married with two grown children.
She lives and works in Dong Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents
Khoa has been involved in this business for seven years.
The main hardship that Khoa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filtering system.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filtering system .

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fish and crabs vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and crabs to sell .

Emma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and crabs to sell

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
Ma. Rolita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store. Ma. Rolita successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is posting Ma. Roleta's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola una madre cabeza de familia de 36 años de edad que desde finales de septiembre del año 2013 inicio por necesidad económica un puesto de venta de comida, con el cual ha podido hacerse cargo de sus dos hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad, de lso gastos de la casa y ha podido ayudarle a sus familiares, se siente muy orgullosa de su puesto de trabajo humilde, pero gracias a él, ha logrado levantar una familia ejerciendo los papeles de padre y madre al mismo tiempo.
Esta poderosa madre quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido y mejoraras a su carro de comida, pensar en ampliarlo y poder en un futuro ofrecer productos nuevos, sueña con poder darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar y seguir mejorando sus ventas y quien sabe en un día podamos verla de nuevo solicitando un crédito para montar su restaurante.
texts.en:
Paola is 36 years old. She is a mother and is the head of her family. Since the end of the month of September, 2013, she has owned a food stall, which she started because she needed income. Through this business she has been able to look after her two children (who are 10 and 17 years old), cover household expenses, and help her family members.

Paola is very proud of her business which, though humble, has enabled her to raise a family and play the part of both mother and father.

This powerful mother wants to request a loan to purchase supplies and to make improvements to her food cart, which she is thinking of expanding and hopes in the future will be able to offer new products. Paola dreams of continuing to improve her sales; and of being able to give her children the opportunity to study. Who knows, one day we may see Paola requesting a new loan to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and make improvements to her food truck.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in the city of Vedi in the Ararat region. She is 43 years old did not receive a higher education. For several years she worked at the textile factory as a weaver and later she worked at the polyclinics as a cashier. Now, her main occupations are the care of her family and her piece of land on which she cultivates wheat and tomatoes and also has a nice vineyard. All her produce she sells during the week from her house. Astghik’s husband works at the school as a teacher of physical education. Their children, a son and daughter, are students. Their son studies at the Yerevan State University of Physical Education and their daughter studies at the Yerevan State Linguistic University's paid division, which causes great difficulty for this family. Today Astghik is very worried, since they are unable to pay for her education.
She will be unbelievably thankful and happy if Kiva lenders help her in her request. This loan, in an amount of 250,000 Armenian drams, will help her to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province, Chantha is 51 years old and the mother of six children.  She can earn income to support her family’s condition via rice cropping and working for others for a fee.  She has been involved in this business for ages. 

This is the sixth loan cycle for Chantha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have uplifted her lifestyle gradually.  In a group of two members, Chantha is the group leader.  She will spend her entire loan portion buying fertilizer to support her rice farm.  She hopes to get a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 25 years old and married to Eunice. He is blessed with one child. He has been in the motor transport business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy a spare wheel for his motorcycle.                                                                                           

Kennedy will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family’s basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a spare wheel for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josie is 40 years old and five of her children are currently in school.

Josie has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Josie requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business.

Josie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for her repair business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 55 years old and has nine children. She is a married woman, and she works very hard to help her family. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda is 41 years old.

Belinda has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Belinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Twenty-five years ago, Caroline started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Mugwe, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one.

Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Caroline believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Caroline waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is a freshman in the European Studies Program, and this is her story:

“I came to study at AUCA from a small village in Tajikistan. Ninety-five percent of its territory is mountainous, which makes living difficult. The land is only suitable for limited agriculture, due to the lack of land and pure water. It’s needless to say that food and clothing are very expensive in this environment, and access to quality education is a huge challenge in such conditions. Given all these circumstances, I’m really lucky to study at one of the best Universities in Central Asia and to have the opportunity to access the Kiva loan, through the university.

Good education is one of the important things in our family. My parents do their best to give us good education, despite my father being the only breadwinner in our family of five. I am happy to be an Alumna of Aga Khan Lyceum, which educates smart students and provides high-quality education. I want to learn foreign languages, make friends among international students at AUCA, and visit other countries in future, in order to pursue a graduate degree in one of them. I passed the AUCA entering exams successfully and now I am a freshman. I hope Kiva lenders will support me in my intentions, implementation of which is vital for my further success in life."

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the European Studies Program.

loans.name: Juditah

texts.en:
Juditah has two children and is a hardworking, creative woman who wants to support herself using her own ideas so she does not have to ever rely on anybody else. She is a rural farmer in Chuka, Kenya an area known for having the best climate that supports farming. Juditah has been practicing mixed farming for 10 years.
