On her farm, she grows maize and has a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in a side business to supplement the meager income she earns from farming. But farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite meager earnings. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" 

Juditah requested a another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow and increase her dairy business. She is planning to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Juditah formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that produces milk daily, which Juditah sells to a co-operative. "The money from milk comes regularly and is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Juditah. The money Juditah earned from selling the milk was adequate to repay a loan. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Juditah is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is a 32-year-old married man, living with his family in Hodeidah,Yemen. He is an educated man and is employed in the private sector as a car mechanic. 

The house where Ala lives with his family is very old and not renovated on the inside. It needs to undergo renovation because it is not a safe place for living. Ala works hard to renovate it, but his income is not high enough to do that. Ala turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) and asked a loan of 300,000 YER in order to purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, and sand in order to renovate the house to make it more safe and suitable for living.

Ala hopes one day to purchase other new floors and renovate them in order to rent them.

loans.use: to renovate the house to make it more safe and suitable for living.

loans.name: Nedy

texts.en:
Nedy is married with two children, and the family lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, and she has always been known to provide the best for it.

Nedy is earning a living by making snacks that she sells on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 7,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area.

With the help and support of her husband, Nedy smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for the snacks she makes and sells

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn, who loves flowers, lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Flower production and barbecue vending are her businesses. 

Because Rowelyn needs to have good flower production, she needs to buy flower insect spray to have good flower harvest. Because of this, she is borrowing money from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to buy insect spray for flower production so she can generate savings. This amount of money will be a big help to her and her family.

loans.use: To buy insect spray for flower production to generate savings

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39-year old married woman with six children. Three children are currently in school.

Maribeth has been in the pig fattening business for four years now, and has borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain it. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Surrya's Group

texts.en:
Surrya is 35 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. She owns a beauty parlor and is an expert in makeover services. Most of her clients are from the neighborhood and appreciate her services. With the passage of time, her beauty products have been diminishing. At this time, she wants to buy more beauty products for her beauty salon.

Therefore, Surrya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan she will be able to buy new beauty products, such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, and lotion.

She wants to establish a parlor in the main market of town, because she wants to enhance her income. Surrya thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new beauty products, such as facial cream, bleach cream, and lotion.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new housewares.

loans.name: Rozee

texts.en:
Rozee is 48 years old. She is a mother of two children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits and other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. 

Rozee's husband speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well. Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Rozee has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergent, biscuits and other goods. 

Rozee hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. Rozee thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergent and biscuits.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat lives in the countryside in Tajikistan. She is widowed and has three children. She always works hard to provide her children with decent living conditions, but she has experienced a lot of difficulties doing so as a widow.

To make a living Mamlakat raises cows, then sells them in the local marketplace. Her son helps her manage her business. She also grows potatoes for additional income.

Even with all of her hard work, Mamlakat’s income is still not enough to improve living conditions. To increase her capital and so enable her to buy another cow, she is applying for a loan of 3,000 TJS. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Sajama 27 Group

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 61 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 27 y 25 años y tres hijas de 31, 23 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, emprendedora, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias y algunos mercados de la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ una zona caracterizada por su clima frio y seco con una temperatura constante de 13 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Cristina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español (sentada al centro viste una manta de vicuña). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la plomería y su hija menor que estudia en la escuela, el resto de sus hijos ya son independientes, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su deseo por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de tomates, confección de tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción, tejido a máquina, venta de empanadas, comercio de cosméticos y venta de ropa de temporada, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, anteriormente vendía mantas y frazadas, con el paso del tiempo los productos fueron cambiando hasta vender sólo ropa de temporada. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa por mayor debido a las ventas de fin de año, para generar mejores beneficios y pagar los gastos de graduación de colegio de su hija menor.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de graduación de colegio de su hija menor.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 61 year old woman; married and mother to two sons ages 27 and 25 and three daughters, ages 31, 23 and 17. She makes a living selling clothes. She is strong; a fighter; entrepreneurial; active; responsible and hard-working. She performs her business at fairs and various markets in the 'Cruce Villa Adela' area; an area characterized for its cold and dry weather, with a constant temperature of 13 degrees centigrades throughout the whole year. Cristina has a dark complexion, long black hair, short, and her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish (she is sitting at the center with a vicuna blanket). She has a life with her husband who works in plumbing and with her youngest daughter who studies at school. The rest of her children are independent, they live in their own homes made of brick and that have potable water, electricity and gas. 

Her desire to diversify her business led her to organize an entrepreneurship bank with people who work in businesses such as: selling tomatoes; weaving; selling fish; construction; machine knitting; selling empanadas; cosmetics trade; and seasonal clothing sales. All this in order to request a loan and to succeed in their commercial endeavors. Her business is that of selling clothes, previously she used to sell blankets and rugs but as time progressed, her products changed until only seasonal clothing was sold. This is the second sequence of loans with the organization in the 12 years that she has been working in this field. Her dream is to diversify her business, she wishes to buy clothes in bulk due to the end-of-the-year sales in order to generate greater benefits and to pay the school graduation expenses of her youngest daughter. These are the reasons why Cristina is requesting a loan to purchase clothes in bulk and with the benefits pay her youngest daughter's graduation expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk and with the benefits pay for school graduation expenses of her youngest daughter.

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan is 33 years old and is married with two children who both attend school. For the past two years she has run a sari sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income with her prepaid mobile phone loading service.

Roxan has borrowed and successfully repaid ten loans from NWTF in the past. She has now requested a 22,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell. She is working hard to expand her business incrementally and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders for the second loan he was given, which helped him with his taxi business. He was very satisfied with the KosInvest loan process and results both times.

Nazmi is now applying for a third loan, this time for 1,700 EUR. He needs to get his taxi repaired and replace its tires so he will be ready for the winter season and its snow and ice. He promises again that he will pay on time and wants to thank all of his lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To repair his taxi and replace its tires so as to be ready for the winter season

loans.name: Alban

texts.en: Alban is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents. Alban is the family's main source of income. He sells vehicles, working very long hours and for a small salary. He loves his parents very much and wants to help them improve their living conditions and lives. Right now, he is requesting a loan so that he can renovate the house and make necessary repairs before the upcoming winter season. His dream is to own his own business, and he is committed to working hard and long hours in order to save money for his future. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate the house and make necessary repairs before the upcoming winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfume, clothes, domestic and women's accessories, as well as christmas items.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Vicente, es un grupo que se encuentra en el 5to ciclo y la integran 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cada una tiene su emprendimiento en el que se esmeran día a día.
La Sra. Fanny, quien encabeza este grupo se caracteriza por su laboriosidad y creatividad, es docente, enseña un turno y en sus horas libres hace bordados para vender. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante y capacitarse.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos, para poder seguir con su bordado, y de esa forma poder tener los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called San Vicente. They are on their 5th loan and are made up of 18 very hard working and determined women. Each of them has their own business venture which they work hard on every day.

Fanny is the head of the group and she is known for her hard work and creativity. She is a teacher, she works for one shift and then in her spare time she does embroidery to sell. She is someone who wants to get ahead and teach herself things. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabric and thread so that she can continue with her embroidery and therefore earn money to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools that will let her work more effectively and efficiently

loans.name: Thư

texts.en:
Thư is 39 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years she has worked on her farm raising poultry and cattle.

The main hardship that Thư and her family faces is not having a hygienic latrine. She has requested a 15,000,000 VND loan through FPW to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filtration system.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filtration system.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María Yolanda es una persona humilde que vive en san miguel provincia de bolívar en la comunidad pucara, pertenece a la ventanilla rural la nueva esperanza, ella no cuenta con un trabajo estable y tiene que mantener a sus cuatro hijos, es madre soltera y solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y frejol para luego sembrar y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia ya que sus hijos estudian y necesitan para el diario vivir. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada ocho días su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas y así no arrendar. 
En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y atender a sus hijos, le gusta el carnaval y la navidad que son costumbres de su comunidad en donde puede realizar trabajos extras y obtener más dinero para sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria Yolanda is a humble person who lives in San Miguel, in the province of Bolivar, in the community of Pucara; belonging to the rural window of Nueva Esperanza. She does not have a stable job and has to take care of her four children; she is a single mother and she is requesting a loan to purchase corn seeds and beans to sow and obtain a good yield. That way she can pay off her family's expenditures since her children study and need resources in their daily living. She shops in San Pablo every eight days and her dream is to purchase land to sow more and as to not to lease. In her free time she likes to watch TV and take care of her children; she likes the carnival and christmas seasons since they are part of her community's customs and where she can also perform additional jobs and obtain more money for her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and beans.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Soledad is 57 years old now.

Soledad has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional clothes, shorts, etc.

Soledad has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Julie Alejandra

texts.es:
Julie una madre soltera de tan solo 24 años de edad con un hijo ya muy grande con 8 años que ha sido la felicidad y motor de su vida y es por él que hoy quiere emprender, crear empresa, buscar el triunfo laboral y lo hará solicitando un crédito que invertirá para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa una actividad que le enseño su exesposo y con este empleo tiene la determinación de triunfar pues necesita una entrada para mantener a su hijo y hará hasta lo imposible para que su retoño no llegue a pasar necesidades y pueda seguir estudiando. 
Con el crédito comprara variedad de ropa para hombre y dama como jean, camisas, camisetas y blusas para iniciar. 
Su sueño es lograr competir con la fuerte competencia que tiene y algún día comprar su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Julie Alejandra is a single mother just 24 years old with an 8-year-old son that has been the joy and driving force of her life. It is because of him that today she wants to start a business, to search for success in work, and she will achieve it by asking for a loan that she will invest to start her own business selling clothing.

Her ex-husband taught her this business, and with this job she has the determination to triumph. She needs a way to support her son and will do everything possible so that her little boy doesn't have to pass up necessities and can continue studying.

With the loan she will buy a variety of clothes for men and women, like jeans, shirts, T-shirts and blouses, to start. Her dream is to succeed in competing with the strong competition that she has and to one day buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for men and women, like jeans, shirts, T-shirts and blouses, to start.

loans.name: Lena

texts.ru: Лена, 45 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, сейчас с родителями живет только младший сын. Лена работает технологом в цехе по производству творога и сметаны. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводство. Начав свою деятельность в 2004 году, на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 5 овец, 5 коз и 1 лошадь. Она полна сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом, так как нужно помогать своим детям. В целях расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения выручки. Доходы от кредита Лена планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Lena is 45, married, and the mother of five children. Only their youngest son lives with them. Lena works in a facility that produces cottage cheese and sour cream and also raises livestock as an additional source of income. She started her business in 2004 and currently has two cows, five sheep, five goats, and a horse. She is full of strength and energy to expand her business and do the work she loves because she needs to help her children. In order to expand her business she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy ten sheep to increase her revenue. She plans to use the profits to continue investing in the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара, 43 года, замужем, многодетная мама 3 детей, они учатся в школе и в университете. Образование у Чынары высшее педагогическое, много лет она работает воспитателем в детском саду. Она очень ответственная, аккуратная и трудолюбивая, главной ценностью в жизни считает своих детей. Ища дополнительный доход для своей семьи, Чынара 4 года назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 3 лошади, жеребенка и 20 овец. Также Чынара выращивает ячмень, сено и картофель на 1,025 ГА земли. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет Чынаре разводить скот и заготавливать для него корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 лошадей с целью их откорма и перепродажи в живом виде. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, постройку сарая для скота. Развитый бизнес поможет Чынаре дать образование ее любимым детям.
texts.en: Chynara is 43, married and the mother of three children, who are studying at school and at university. Chynara has a higher education in the field of pedagogy and was a kindergarten teacher for many years. She is very responsible, precise and hardworking, and she considers the most important thing in her life to be her children. Searching for a source of additional income, Chynara began farming four years ago. She currently has three horses, a foal and 20 sheep. She also grows barley, hay and potatoes on a 1.025 hectare plot of land. The profits from her business allow her to raise livestock and stock up on feed for the winter. In order to continue developing her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy three horses to fatten and resell. Chynara plans to use the profits to invest in expanding her farm and to build a barn for livestock. Expanding her business will help Chynara give her beloved children an education.

loans.use: to purchase three horses to fatten and resell in order to increase her profits and pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build the back part of her house with noble material.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 36 años de edad, es una mujer que conforma su familia con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 13 años. Ella emulando la actividad comercial practicada por su madre, encontró la forma de generar ingresos, dedicandose al comercio de ropa, acesorios, colonias, perfumes, etc, articulos que vende directamente a sus consumidores finales, quienes son principalmente sus vecinos y referídos por sus amigos,  y que le permiten ganar poco a poco una clientela fija. Su meta es lograr el incremento de sus ventas y con ello aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia, aunque su principal desafio es lograr fuentes de financiación, que le ayuden a tener un efectivo disponible, para comprar en un amyor volumen. En la actualidad está aplicando a unc redikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa exterior, perfumería y accesorios femeninos; con esta inversión sus inventarios serán mayores y sus ventas tambien mejorano aun mas las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old; she has a family made up of her partner and her two children, ages 6 and 13. Emulating her mother's trade, she found a way to generate income selling clothes, accessories, colognes, perfumes, etc. Articles that she sells directly to her consumers; they are mainly her neighbors and others references by her friends; this has allowed her to increase her clientele base, little by little. Her goal is to increase her sales and increase the quality of life of her family, even though her main challenge is to garner funding sources that will provide her with available cash to purchase higher volumes. 

She is currently applying for a redikiva, the first loan she will be requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with which she will purchase clothing, perfume and women accessories. With this loan her inventory will be greater and her sales will improve her business conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, perfumes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra was born in 1961. She is a responsible mother of three children. One year ago, Gulchehra began her own business of animal husbandry because she needed to earn money. She started her business with two cows. She usually buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market.

Gulchehra works hard and tries to develop her business. She perfects her knowledge little by little. Gulchehra’s working day usually begins early in the morning, when she feeds the cows. Her husband helps her to manage her business. Gulchehra is going to increase the number of cows she feeds. In this way, she will improve her business and earn more income.

With her profit, she is going to provide her children with a good education. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistani somoni to buy cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Kelly Shair

texts.es: Esta es la historia de una joven de tan solo 21 años de edad que de la mano de interactuar quiere iniciar su negocio, buscando algún día poder comprar una casa propia. Kelly una mujer emprendedora, con ganas de salir adelante, de trabajar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida que viene a solicitar un ayuda crediticia para iniciar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, como lo son labiales, lociones, cremas para peinar, maquillaje en general, accesorios etc. Etc. Etc.  Una mujer soltera que solo espera la ayuda que en muchas empresas le han negado para trabajar y demostrar todas sus capacidades empresariales para triunfar en la vida laboral.
texts.en:
This is the story of a 21-year-old young woman that wants to start her business hand-in-hand with Interactuar, looking to one day buy her own house. Kelly is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to succeed, to work and to improve her living conditions. 

She has come to ask for a loan to start her business selling beauty products from a catalog, like lipsticks, lotions, hair creams, general makeup, accessories, etc. She is a single woman that just wants the help that many businesses have denied her (the ability to work) and to demonstrate all her business abilities to triumph in the working world.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to start her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and iron and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is 28 years old and married with one child. He is a very hard worker and does much in order to earn a living for his family. Right now he works in a market where he sells clothing and shoes. He purchases these items at cheap prices and sells them for higher prices to earn a profit. 

His goal is to be able to open his own boutique one day, especially because working in the market is difficult in cold and bad weather conditions. 

Burim is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and shoes to re-sell. This loan will enable him to continue with his business, which he considers very profitable and he enjoys. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Zajim

texts.en:
Zaim is 32 years old and has four children. His wife is a housewife and stays at home to care for the house and children while he is the main source of the family's income. Zaim is a woodworker; he constructs doors and windows from wood. He is a very hard worker who does much in order to improve his family's living conditions. 

Zaim is well-known in his area and has a lot of work for his business. In the beginning, he started with only a small machine but has been able to  expand and grow into a much larger business. 

At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to renovate his workshop, which is in urgent need. He hopes in the future he will be able to continue to improve his business, increasing his income and production capacity. His goal is to give his children a better education and future.

loans.use: To renovate his construction workshop.

loans.name: Soccorro

texts.en:
Soccorro is 50 years old, married, with four beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost ten years. From this long experience of selling, she already has great knowledge in dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Soccorro still gets more customers than the rest due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. Over the years, she has been successful and she manages to save more money for her family. 

Now, Soccorro is planning to buy a parcel of land in order to manage a new business for additional income in the near future, which is creating a small pigpen. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 500 kilos of bananas for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC).

loans.use: to purchase 500 kilos of bananas for wholesale.

loans.name: Estrellas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
Pamela es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de cinco y un años, y su negocio es la venta de carne de cerdo.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Garita de lima’ un área caracterizada por el comercio informal en la calle, donde comerciantes de carne, ropa, juguetes, comida, etc., conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco a una temperatura de 15 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Pamela es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, de baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español, su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres junto a sus dos niños, ambos todavía no están en edad escolar (sentada a la derecha, usa sueter rojo). Ella vive en un cuarto propio de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. La necesidad por generar mejores ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio técnico de equipos, venta de muebles, venta de edredones, confección de carteras de cuero, venta de salteñas, confección de polleras y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de carne de cerdo y los cortes que realiza son; Jamón, Lomo, Lado, Boston trasero, Picnic y Otros. Actualmente no cuenta con sierra cortadora de carne, realiza el trabajo de forma manual con un cuchillo y una pequeña hacha, sus clientes son fieles y constantes. Su sueño es tener una carnicería propia bajo techo, y desea realizar la compra de una sierra cortadora de carne por motivo de las fiestas venideras de fin de año, donde las ventas crecen y ella teme perder clientes. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en seis años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pamela solicita un préstamo para la compra de una sierra cortadora de carne para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y no perder clientes.
texts.en:
Pamela is a 23 year old woman. She is single and has two children, who ares 5 and 1. She has a business where she sells pork. She is independent, entrepreneurial, a good mother, responsible, and hardworking. She works in the "Garita de Lima" zone, an area characterized by street merchants who sell meat, clothing, toys, food, etc. and live side-by-side. It is cold and dry, and the temperature is around 15 degrees Celsius year-round. 

Pamela is dark-skinned, has long, black hair, is short, and speaks Aymara, her native language, and Spanish. She lives in her parents' home with her two children, who are not yet school-aged. In the photograph, she is seated to the right and wearing a red sweater. She lives in her own room, which is made of brick, and has running water and electricity. 

Because she needed to earn more money, she formed a group of people with businesses like technical services, furniture sales, quilt sales, leather purse sales, salteñas (meat pie) sales, skirt sales, and empanada making so that they could request a loan and improve their businesses. She sells pork products like ham, pork loin, Lado, pork shoulder, deli meat, and other cuts. She does not currently have a meat slicer; she cuts the meat by hand with a knife and a small axe. Her customers are loyal and frequent. Her dream is to have her own butcher shop and she hopes to purchase a meat slicer for the coming end-of-the-year celebration when sales grow, since she is afraid of losing customers.

This is the group's fourth loan with the institution in the six years that they have been members. Pamela has requested a loan to purchase a meat slicer to take advantage of the end-of-year celebrations so that she doesn't lose customers.

loans.use: to purchase a meat slicer to take advantage of the end-of-year celebrations so that she doesn't lose customers.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Un idea que nació de la desesperación y de la necesidad fue la que  ayudo a la señora Cruz a salir de diferentes dificultades económicas que presentaba su familia quien la conforma su esposo y dos hijos adolescentes, un hombre de 15 años y una mujer de 17 años, gracias a la venta de comida Cruz pudo solventar la ausencia económica e hizo de esta idea un negocio sostenible en el poco tiempo que lleva operando, es un negocio que no genera mucho pero ayuda y quiere hacer de esta venta de comida toda una empresa, por dicha razón solicita un crédito para la compra de un congelador con el que podrá depositar los insumos y alimentos. 
Este crédito ayudara a Cruz a tener más implementos para ir poco a poco formando su muy soñado restaurante.
texts.en:
An idea born out of need and desperation was what helped Cruz get out of various financial challenges her family was facing. Her family is made up of her husband and two adolescent children, a 15-year-old boy and a 17-year-old girl.

Thanks to her food sales, Cruz was able to resolve her lack of finances and she's made a viable business of her idea in the short time it's been operating. It is a business that does not generate a lot, but it helps. She wants to make a real business of her food sales. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a freezer which she will be able to use to store food and supplies.

This loan will help Cruz to have more equipment to continue setting up her much dreamed-about restaurant little by little.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her business.

loans.name: María Deisy

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, es una señora que estudio hasta bachillerato contador debido a que tenía que trabajar para poder continuar con sus estudios en la universidad y fue un ciclo a la universidad estudiando contaduría pública; pero como tenía que trabajar durante el día y estudiar durante la noche y en algunas ocasiones los horarios de estudio le chocaban con el trabajo, decidió mejor dedicarse a trabajar y dejar los estudios, ella es soltera vive con sus padres los cuales dependen de ella.

María trabaja como vendedora de productos de belleza por catálogo,  desde hace año y medio y comenta que todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien en su trabajo, ella entro a trabajar con esta empresa gracias a que una amiga trabaja en este mismo puesto y decidió emigrar y le dejo a ella el trabajo y desde entonces ella se dedica a vender productos por catálogo.  


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar lociones, cremas, cosméticos, ropa interior femenina, etc., pues comenta que tiene una alta demanda de sus cliente de productos que no los tiene y ella quiere ofrecerlos para satisfacer las necesidades  y así poder obtener más ganancias económicas.


María planea para un futuro incrementar sus ventas, además poder arreglar su casa y poder ampliarla, ella sueña con poder retomar sus estudios universitarios y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida, también desea poder casarse y ser madre de sus propios hijos.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and attended a high school program for accounting. She needed to work in order to continue studying at university, so she attended a semester of university and studied public accounting. However, she had to work during the day and study at the night, and sometimes her school schedule conflicted with her work schedule. She decided it was better to dedicate herself to work and leave school. She lives with her parents, whom she supports.

María sells beauty products from a catalog. She has done this for about a year and a half, and tells us that it has gone very well. She began working in this business thanks to a friend who works for the same company and decided to leave the country and her job. Since then, María has sold products from the catalog. 

She will use the loan to purchase lotions, creams, cosmetics, female undergarments, etc. There is a high demand for these products that she doesn't have, so she would like to offer them to satisfy the demand and earn more money.

María plans to increase her sales in the future and furnish and expand her home. She dreams of returning to university to study and have a better quality of life. She also wants to get married and have her own children.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, cosmetics, female undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a hardworking man and wants a loan to buy pigs for slaughtering to sell. 

He has a butcher shop where he sells pork as his major business. He does this along with rearing pigs, after realizing that the butcher shop alone cannot fetch enough income. 

He has a great dream of building a house, though he is challenged by theft.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy millet, black-eyed peas, sorghum and coffee to resell

loans.name: Lorderito

texts.en:
Lorderito is a 50-year old fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He is married with five grown children. 

Lorderito relies on fishing to earn a living. It is not easy work for him. He is always on the open sea, working hard, mostly at night to get a good catch. With patience and perseverance, he has remained in this business for 27 years. He is asking for a loan to buy plywood, floaters, rope, fishing nets, nylon, paints, and adhesive. He know that once these items are available, they will make his work easier.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to increase his profits and savings.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is a 38-year-old hardworking woman married to Samuel who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children.  Callen has been a landlady for ten years earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Callen is now servicing her 3rd loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy some iron sheets and metal doors to finish building her rental house.

Callen plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, build a rental house in the nearby town and she hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets and metal doors.

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es:
Rosmira, de 50 años, tiene un negocio en el que vende alimentos y bebidas en una pequeña chaza ubicada en el municipio de Bello.

Rosmira trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar surtido de gaseosas, licores y comestibles.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosmira is 50 years old and has a business where she sells food and drinks in a small location in the Bello municipality. Rosmira works every day from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. She is responsible, sensible, and dedicated to her business.

One of her dreams is to open a small restaurant where she could offer different types of food and employ some people. She requests a loan to provide capital to her business and purchase sodas, liquor, and food. 

The loan will impact her life positively because it will allow her to achieve her goal of offering a greater variety of products to her customers. She supports her children with her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, liquor, and food.

loans.name: Elkin Humberto

texts.es:
Elkin es un empresario que tiene el placer de viajar por las rutas de Colombia participando como intermediario, gracias a sus capacidades y gusto por el trabajo logro comprar un camión el cual utiliza para trabajar como distribuidor, llevando legumbres a la zona de Urabá y aprovecha y trae plátano el cual distribuye en plazas de mercado.
Elkin aprovechando su espacio quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra masiva de plátano para llevarlo a la ciudad de Medellín y mejorar sus ingresos. 
Elkin tiene una dificultad y es enfrentarse a la inseguridad del sector donde trabaja, puesto que tiene que pasar por diferentes adversidades para entregar y recoger sus productos.
texts.en:
Elkin is an entrepreneur who has the pleasure of traveling on routes through Colombia and participating as an intermediary.  Thanks to his skills and love of work he was able to buy a truck which he uses to work as a distributor, taking vegetables to areas of Urabá and bringing back bananas which he distributes in the various markets. Elkin faces the challenge of confronting the insecurity in his sector of business. He often has to travel through different diverse and potentially dangerous areas of the country in order to collect and distribute his products. 

Elkin wants to take advantage of the space he has and is requesting a loan to buy a huge quantity of bananas to take to the city of Medellin where he will sell them and thereby improve his income.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of bananas in Urabá to take to Medellín.

loans.name: Behxhet

texts.en:
Behxhet is 55 years old and has five children that are between the ages of 12 and 20 years old. He works with iron and copper and is the main source of income for his family. The iron and copper business is new for him and he is hopeful that it will be very profitable in the future. 

At this time, Behxhet is in need of a loan to purchase new tools and equipment for working with the iron and copper. He is hopeful that he will be able to hire an employee and continue to expand his business. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and equipment for working with iron and copper.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 20-year old university student. His major is Banking and Finance. He lives in the Svay Reang province of Cambodia. 

Due to a lack of financial support, Sina would like to secure a loan to pay his tuition fees. This loan will help him graduate and build his future. After graduation, he wants to find a job with reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter's previous loan improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his tailoring business and earn a higher income. He is requesting another loan from Yehu in the amount of 25,000 KES, which he will use to diversify by purchasing bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making  business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising pigs. 

Nenita, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 16000 to buy additional materials such as woods, nails, paints, etc. for her furniture-making  business. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ganimete

texts.en:
Ganimete wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan, which has helped her to buy additional food products for her store. She is very happy with the resulting income, and has been able to improve her family's living conditions.

Ganimete likes her job very much and has a pleasant personality, which helps in attracting her many customers. She even allows customers to pay when they get paid if they are low on money, which also adds to her success and popularity with people.

Ganimete is now requesting another loan to purchase more food items in order to generate more income. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders

loans.use: to purchase more food items

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Marmara village in Kaduna state. 

Before becoming a Babban Gona member, Adamu had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Adamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothing...), and store his maize harvest to sell it later fo more profits

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Kanakargo village in Kaduna state. Before joining Babban Gona member, Isiyaku had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more profits. Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (for food, clothing...), and store his maize harvest to sell it later for more profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her family's living conditions by renovating the house.

loans.name: Muntari

texts.en: Muntari is a maize farmer from Hana Aiki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Muntari would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muntari can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Muntari, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Sabon Layi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses (food, clothing..), while storing his maize harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es madre de dos hijos de 10 y 8 años. (Ver Foto)

Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la cultivación agricultura desde hace 15 años. Ella aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos. 

Sandra sueña con tener un negocio sostenible y prospero. 

¡Impacte la vida de Sandra y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Sandra is the mother of two children, 10 and 8 years old. (See photo). Other than her family, she has focused on agricultural work for fifteen years. She learned this business empirically, that is to say, by observing other people. 

She and her family live in a rural area of Colombia where there is no easy access to financial services such as those offered by Interactuar. She will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seed, pest control products,  and compost to prepare her crops. 

Thanks to this loan, the economy and quality of life of her family may improve as her income increases.  Sandra dreams of having a prosperous and sustainable business. Make a difference in the life of Sandra and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seed and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquín de 69 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos en una empresa cercana, además Joaquín buscando tener mejores ingresos hace 15 años decidió invertir en un negocio de venta de pollo empanizado, el cual es atendido por su compañera de vida. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su  compañera de vida desde hace 30 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este beneficio. Joaquín sabe que su negocio genera una buena cantidad de los ingresos de su hogar, por lo que desea incrementar los productos a ofrecer incluyendo además platillos típicos, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollo, empanizador, yuca, tomates, repollo, etc. Y lograr así tener más clientela y mejores ganancias preparando mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Joaquín is 69-years old.  He is a hard-working man who earns his living offering domestic services at a nearby company.  In addition, fifteen years ago,when Joaquín was looking to improve his income, he decided to invest in a business selling breaded chicken.  His wife oversees the business.  Joaquín has lived in his own home with his wife for the last thirty years.  He feels very happy to have this blessing.  Joaquín knows that his business generates a good amount of income for his home, which is why he wants to increase the products he offers, including local fare.  That is why he made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI; he will invest in chicken, bread crumbs, yucca, tomatoes, cabbage etc.  By preparing a variety of products, he will have a greater clientele and improved profits.

loans.use: to invest in chicken, bread crumbs, yucca, tomatoes, cabbage etc.

loans.name: Sopanete Group

texts.fr: SOPANETE est un groupement de personnes qui est composé de 10 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes et qui vivent dans le même quartier. Elles se réunissent pratiquement tous les fins de semaines  et organisent des tontines. Madame Adjara est la présidente de ce groupement, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus. Elle sollicite ce montant pour aller dans la sous région acheter des tissus légèrs comme les voiles, les meulfeux et les khartoum qu’elle revend à ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à  8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Et voudrait à l’avenir renforcer et diversifier son stock de marchandises et obtenir le monopole de la vente de tissus dans le marché de sa commune. Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sopanete is a group made up of 10 individuals who are all women and who live in the same neighborhood. They get together almost every weekend and organize revolving savings/investment groups. 

Madame Adjara is the president of this group; she's the one who raised her hand in the photo. She is a married mother of a household and she sells cloth. She is requesting this amount so as to go to the back country in order to buy light cloth such as veils, 'meulfeux' and 'khartoums' which she resells to her clients. She helps her husband with covering the family's daily expenses and the school fees for her children. 

Madame Adjara  begins her day at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. She has more than five years' experience in this business. In future, she would like to grow  and diversify her inventory and obtain a monopoly on the sale of cloth in the market of her community. She would also like to grow her income and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy light sorts of cloth like veils and 'khartoums'

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village est créé le 01 décembre 2009  a en ses actifs huit cycles dans le programme. Il est composé de femmes très dynamiques et désireuses d’améliorer leurs conditions socio économiques. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs décennies, elles un bon esprit de groupe caractérisé par la solidarité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluies.
Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle âgée de 33 ans, est mère de cinq enfants dont deux filles et trois garçons. Elle a un étalage dans le village ou elle vend.
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va s’approvisionner en riz qu’elle achète à 13000f le sac , un bidon d’huile à 15000F et un grosse de savon à 22500F qu’elle revendra à 275F le kg , le pot 150f et le savon à 250F CFA.

 Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge sa famille en améliorant l’alimentation  et accroître son épargne pour prétendre à un crédit plus important dans le futur.
texts.en:
This ’banc villageois’ was created on December 1, 2009. It has completed eight loan cycles in the program, and it is composed of very energetic women wishing to improve their socio-economic situation. They have all lived in the same village for several decades and have a good team spirit characterized by solidarity. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and rainy-season farming.  

Ms. Mariama (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 33 years old and a married mother of five children (2 girls and 3 boys). She has a display in the village where she sells her merchandise. 

With this new loan, she is going to stock up on rice, which she purchases at 13,000 francs per sack; a containers of oil at 15,000 francs; and a quantity of soap at 22,500 francs that she will resell [….]

The profits from her business will enable her to take better care of her family by improvements in food and to increase her savings in order to claim bigger loans in the future.

loans.use: to stock up on rice, oil, and soap to resell

loans.name: Kadiatou  Alimou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou Alimou (debout à l’extrême droite la main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants dont 06 garçons et 03 filles. C’est une femme très déterminée à faire prospérer ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle est vendeuse de poisson.
  
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter 30 kg de poisson à 24000F et deux caisses de poulets à 32000F.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et d’apporter son  soutien à son marie dans gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created during the inauguration of the banc villageois which took place in the second half of 2013. It is composed of very dynamic women who share a strong bond through the ties of solidarity and mutual aid. They have all lived in the same district for several years. Their principal source of income is their small-scale retail ventures.

Ms Kadiatou, the woman to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's star borrower. She is a 59-year-old married mother to nine children: six sons and three daughters. She is very determined to make her revenue-generating activities prosper. She earns a living through selling fish.

With this loan, she is going to purchase 30 kilos of fish for 24,000 FCFA and two crates of chickens for 32,000 FCFA.
  
These profits will allow her to build up some savings so she can grow her finances and support her husband with their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 30 kilos of fish for 24,000 FCFA and two crates of chickens for 32,000 FCFA

loans.name: Xhelal

texts.en:
Xhelal is from an Ashkali community in Kosovo. He is 28 years old, married, and the father of three children. His wife stays home, caring for the home and children, while he is the main source of income and works in construction. He works long hours, from the early morning until late at night, on various buildings and structures.

At this time he needs a loan, to purchase some tools and equipment for his work. This loan will allow him to continue his business and even improve it. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and equipment for his work in construction.

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Burbuqe is married and has one adult child, 18 years old. In order to earn a living, Burbuqe has a chicken coop and raises chickens to sell. She has been able to expand since she started with only two roosters, and she continues to be able to grow. Her husband sells wood, in order to provide for them.

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and roosters, to continue her business that she started in 2007. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and roosters to continue her business.

loans.name: Gelesu

texts.en: Gelesu is a maize farmer from Karo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gelesu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gelesu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Gelesu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, while storing his maize harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Mphatso Credit Group

texts.en:
Manesi is a 49-year-old single mother of six children and one dependent orphan.

She started her business of selling fish and vegetables 12 years ago in order to support her family and save towards school fees for her children. Since starting her business, with the help of MLF's business training and savings plan, she has managed to build a house with a proper iron sheet roof, buy a bicycle to help get her stock to market quicker and she has also managed to buy a bed and a mattress.

She would like this loan in order to be able to go to the lake to buy her fish in bulk in order to maximize her profit margins. Her next goal is to save enough to purchase a sofa for her home.

She thanks Kiva well-wishers.

loans.use: to purchase more fish in bulk, in order to increase profit margins.

loans.name: Salamata Samba

texts.fr: SALAMATA est une femme qui est âgée de 49 ans et qui évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle est  à son 3ème prêt et demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter des tissus et des draps pour ensuite les vendre. Elle n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 7h30mn et la termine à 18h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.  Ainsi elle pourra renforcer et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamata is a woman aged 49 who has been selling fabric and has more than three years' experience in this business. She is on her third loan and is requesting a loan of this amount to buy fabric and bed sheets. 

She has no relative who is a beneficiary of UIMCEC, and she helps her husband with the daily expenses of the family and the school fees for her children. She begins her day at 7:30 am and finishes at 6 pm. 

In future she would like to open a clothing store. In that way she could expand and diversify her inventory in order to grow her income and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her tailor shop

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which he used to buy a new machine for his work. He has been able to earn more income since this purchase. He is very satisfied with his business and the success that he has had.

Now he is asking for a second loan for his business, which he will use to purchase new electrical tools. This second loan will help him to continue to improve his business and meet the demands and needs of his large customer base. He appreciates all of the lenders and wants to thank everyone.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical tools for his work

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: SOKHNA est une femme âgée de 56 ans et qui s’active toujours dans l’habillement. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et elle a un parent bénéficiaire de crédit dans l’institution. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des habits, des chaussures et des parfums pour les revendre à ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle voudrait à l’avenir avoir sa propre cantine afin de pouvoir renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Seynabou is a 56-year old woman who owns a tailor shop. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She is married and has children. She helps out her husband with the daily outgoings and her children's school fees by working from 8am to 6pm every day.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fabric, shoes and perfume for her tailor shop. In the future she would like to grow her business to increase her income and put some money aside.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and perfume for her tailor shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the toilet, which is an urgent need, and to replace the windows and doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Milady

texts.es: Milady de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella  posee un bazar donde vende una variedad de artículos (osos de peluche, arreglos florales, bolsas para regalos, adornos navideños, etc.) desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado y tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de artículos y por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi podrá tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 51-year-old Milady lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has a shop where she has sold a variety of goods (stuffed bears, floral arrangements, gift bags, Christmas decorations, etc.) for several years. Her business is located in the market and has lots of customers due to the variety of products and good prices. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise in bulk since her sales are going well and she will be able to have bigger earnings.

loans.use: to buy stuffed bears, floral arrangements, gift bags, Christmas decorations, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and three of her children are in school.

Sarah has a business of buying and selling ready-to-wear shoes in the city centre. She requested a loan through UGAFODE to buy stock of craft shoes to add to her stock so that she can have diversity and attract more customers. 

Sarah has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she looks forward to saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She has a grocery store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming, growing rice and fattening pigs.

Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries for her store, like soft drinks, canned goods, and rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her store, like soft drinks, canned goods, and rice.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is 27 years old, married, and has children between seven and ten years old. Her husband works for a water company for a low salary, so he also supplements their income by planting and selling wheat and corn on their land. 

At this time, Milena is requesting a loan in order to purchase tools for their machine that helps plant and harvest the crops. This loan will allow them to work more efficiently and effectively. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to sell more corn and increase her income. 

She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase tools for their machine that helps plant and harvest the crops.

loans.name: Kouya  Dora

texts.fr: KOUYA est mariée et mère de  quatre enfants et est âgée de 39 ans ; elle est commerçante des chaussures et du maîs,s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé ; elle vit à Adidogomé dans une maison dont le toit est en tuile, leur latrine est du type traditionnel et n’a jamais fréquenté, même se soigne par automédication par manque de moyen. KOUYA sollicite un crédit pour améliorer son quotidien, agrandir son étalage, augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire afin de mieux épargner et réaliser l’un de ses rêves qui est de retrouver le chemin des études.
texts.en:
Kouya is 39 years old, married and has four children. She sells shoes and buys her supplies twice a month from the local market. She also sells maize, as a second source of income. Kouya lives in Adidogomé, in a house with a tin roof and a traditional latrine. She never attended school and must treat her ailments herself as she cannot afford to visit a doctor.

Kouya has requested this loan in order to improve her daily life. She plans to increase her range of stock which will improve her profit margins. With her profits she will save and also realize one of her dreams which is to go back to school.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Damina Garba

texts.en: Damina Garba is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Damina Garba had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs (for items such as food and clothes). With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Damina Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Damina Garba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses while storing his maize harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a maize farmer from Tsirya village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Victoria had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothes. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Victoria, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To meet urgent expenses while storing her maize harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FAIDA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement et du charbon de bois.
Les femmes du groupe FAIDA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AWA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la pâte alimentaire (macaroni, spaghetti), du poisson frais et des condiments sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Faida group is made up of married women who on average are 36 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in Dioïla, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family contacts, through living in the same neighborhood, and through friendship. They work in catering, the sale of condiments, the clothing trade and the sale of charcoal. This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women of the Faida group.

The client named Awa, the first person on the right in the row of people standing up, is illiterate. At present, she has a catering business. She plans to buy rice, oil, pasta, fresh fish, and condiments locally from the wholesalers. She sells cooked food for cash at the market to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Nyabange Group

texts.en:
Hoka is a mother of a boy and a girl who are at school. She is married and supports her family by running a general store and tailoring business, a business she has been with for 14 years now. She works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to realize a small monthly profit. 

Hoka is now requesting her second loan support from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She managed to successfully repay her previous loan. Her first credit was small, so she is requesting another so she can further improve her shop and tailoring business to maximum return. By doing that, she will be able to take her children to high school and build a better house for her family. She wants to expand her business and be better in life. Hoka received an extra income, which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. 

Hoka will share this loan with her loan group, Nyabange Group, which totals four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will invest her portion of credit to buy general store stocks -- rice, sugar, maize and baking flour, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy general store stocks such as rice, sugar, maize and baking flour, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Karugembe Group

texts.fr:
J.Pacific fait partie du groupe  Karugembe et  habite à  Bubanza. Il  a  41 ans et est marié à Emelyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 mois  à 16 ans.

Il fait le commerce de haricot, huile de palme et de bananes  depuis  1an. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de haricot, d’huile de palme et de bananes   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait construire une  belle maison  et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Pacific is a member of the Karugembe group and lives in Bubanza. He is 41 years old and is married to a farmer. Together with his wife they have five children, aged from three months to 16 years old. 

He has been selling beans, palm oil, and bananas for one year. He is on his second loan through Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy a large amount of beans, palm oil, and bananas, which he will resell to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a nice house and see his children study hard.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of beans, palm oil, and bananas to resell

loans.name: Dounkafa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DOUNKAFA  ont en moyenne 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur 8ème   prêt solidaire. TENIN, 1 ère  femme debout à la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mils et 10 sacs d’arachides. Elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 23 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Dounkafa Group, on average, are 35 years old, have five children, and all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Ségou (the fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through family ties and sell various goods, including cereals and spices.

Having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the group are on their eighth group loan. Tenin, the first woman standing at left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase three sacks of millet and 10 sacks of ground nuts. She gets her supplies on site from the farmers. Tenin sells to a group of customers made up of women and men for cash and often for credit. 

Tenin expects to see an average monthly profit of 23,000 CFA francs, which will be used for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe vient d’entamer son troisième, il est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’aviculture.

Madame Mayé (en médaillon vers la droite et en bas), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 06 garçons et 02 filles âgés de 08 à 27 ans. Elle s’active dans l’aviculture particulièrement l’élevage de poulet de chair.  Pour se faire elle achète des poussins de moins d’une semaine les élèvent pendant 45 jours au minimum pour l’abattage et  la vente par pièce. Elle vend aussi du jus à base de produits locaux bissap, tamarin, gingembre et pain de singe. Elle fait cette activité depuis plusieurs années et bénéficie d’une grande expérience dans ces domaines. 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un premier vague de 50 poussins, 02 sacs d’aliment les vaccins et divers produits pour la préparation des jus qu’elle vend.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de soutenir son mari dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Created at the same time as the banc villageois, this group has just taken on its third loan. The group is comprised of dynamic women who have great solidarity and like to help one another. They have been living in the same neighborhood for a number of years. Their main activities are small business and poultry farming.

Madame Mayé (pictured in the lower right corner) is the group's star borrower. She is 48 years old, married, and has eight children (six boys and two girls) between the ages of 8 and 27. She raises poultry—specifically chickens. She buys chicks that are a few days old and raises them for at least 45 days before she slaughters them and sells them by the piece. She also sells juice made from local ingredients such as hibiscus flower, tamarind, ginger and baobab fruit. She has been running these businesses for a number of years and has a lot of experience in these areas.

With her new loan, she would like to buy a first wave of 50 chicks, two bags of feed, vaccines, and various products for the juice she sells.

The income from her businesses will allow her to better contribute to improvement of her family's quality of life. It will also allow her to help her husband with their children's schooling.

loans.use: buy 50 chicks, two bags of feed, vaccines, and various products to make juice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
